I left it (postage paid) at check--out with the front desk and asked if they could give it to mail carrier. I got a call when I had boarded the plane from Scott and the front desk saying the mail carrier couldn't take it but he would personally drop it off at the post office on his way home. I couldn't believe he would do that and go above and beyond. My friend received her perfume two days later! Negatives would be the small fitness center, but I never had trouble getting on a treadmill and sheets not as soft as I prefer, but for the price I paid for the room I can't complain. Overall, amazing service, location, rooms and food. Perfect stay and I don't say that often!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: SpeedwayCJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Solamar for a quick overnight in San Diego while attending an event. Had stayed with Kimpton Hotels once prior (Boston) and loved it, so I trusted the brand and that helped make my final hotel decision this time. Got a killer AAA rate on a corner spa room, which was huge and luxurious. My room looked out (through 4 windows!) at Petco Park. Would be an amazing place for baseball fans. Minibar credit for Kimpton In Touch members was a nice touch (first time I've ever had something from a minibar!). Bathroom had a spacious shower with liquid soap, shampoo, conditioner dispensers. Also had a huge, deep spa tub (didn't try this out). Really, just an amazing amount of space in the bedroom/bathroom. Checkin staff was very friendly and helpful. Parking staff were absolutely amazing. Room service staff was terrific and food was delicious! Only drawback, the street in front of the hotel can become extremely busy if there's a game at Petco Park, but the parking staff made it quite easy to handle the crowd and got me in and out of the hotel easily. Overall, an amazing stay. Can't wait to come up with an excuse to spend a couple nights in San Diego, so I can stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: bom2535
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Kimpton Hotels before and this one sure no slightest disappointment. Great location, super staff making our big group check-in in a swift. Friendly front desk staff were really helpful in many occasions. Wine tasting at around 5 pm made our daily warm up great. Tried the roof top bar twice and not disappointed, great atmosphere and even more of great staff who worked more to serve us best. Rooms were great, ample space. I had slight problem with the clogged wash basin but that was very minor. Stayed on the 6th floor which was very close to the noise of the roof top bar but that was not a problem. I did not get any problem in this place and our days here passed quickly. Will no doubt consider this place first for the next SD visit. they are also dogs friendly, by the way....

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - hate parking fees!”
Reviews.Author: Windfeld-C
Reviews.Content: This is our third Kimpton hotel in a few weeks. And the Solamar certainly lives up to the high standards of the other two. And even goes beyond what's expected. We arrived for a two night's stay and parked across the street and saved $11. Kimpton's price was $36 and we have this thing with parking fees. We learned however that public parking was available at $10 overnight a few streets away. We did that for our second night. But you can't really argue with the quality of Kimpton's Solamar Hotel. Great room, perfect location and not to forget the incredible service of the staff. We had a flat tire on our rental car - the valet staff were really great and let us leave our car with them until we could get roadside service to help us out with the right equipment. A special thanks to all the guys in valet.... The only negative thing to say is that there was a lot of noise around the hotel. Our room was on the fourth floor and facing the pool. There was a party at the pool and it was really loud. And the noise continued until very late/early. But overall this was a great stay... And I sure would recommend the Solamar.to everybody going to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: DCroadie
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel. great staff, friendly. Location outstanding. Could walk to everything. Only bummer, the charge for the Business center.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fabulous staff!”
Reviews.Author: Nanaluvsnyc
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent six nights at Hotel Solamar the first week in May. From the time we arrived we were greeted by friendly staff. I don't have all of the names but two of the best were Patrick and Abraham. Every staff member I encountered during our stay was courteous and professional especially the staff who greeted us outside the front doors. The rooms were clean and roomy. The beds were very comfortable. We were on the 8th floor and it was quiet. The hallway was always a little cool because of the fans. The location in the Gaslamp Quarter was excellent. We walked to Petco Park for the game and to the Convention Center. The two negatives are: (1) $35 overnight parking and (2) I did not like the sink in the bathroom. It looks nice but it is impossible not to splash water onto whatever is sitting on the countertop.

Reviews.Title: “Oops! I Forgot Some Wonderful People!”
Reviews.Author: TerrierWhoTravels
Reviews.Content: I forgot to mention some azing staff at Solamar when I wrote my review last night. James brought our luggage up to our room when we arrived Monday, May 09. He spent time with us giving us suggestions as to what we should while in San Diego and where to head to if we rented a car! In JSix we have had outstanding Waitstaff. Thanks to Kristen, Josie and Jamie who ensured that our meals and service were memorable! We should mention that JSix has 1/2 price wine on Wednesday nights. What a deal! We had a bottle of Deutz Blanc de Blanc champagne!! What a bargain plus we rec'd 20% off our bill because we had had breakfast in the restaurant that morning! All in all - amazing food, delicious wine and outstanding service. We have no hesitation in recommending JSix as a dining venue for a romantic dinner (plus breakfasts are delicious!) The only thing we would mention is that it is a touch noisy, so ask for a 2 semi-circle booth or a 4 person booth. Enjoy and thanks Hotel Solamar!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: dinky2
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Solamar based on it's great reviews and we were not disappointed. We were a little concerned about the "pet friendly" aspect of the hotel as my husband has allergies but we mentioned this when booking and there were no problems. Apparently, there are floors reserved for humans only and we certainly didn't see any traces of pets in our room, it was spotlessly clean. In fact it was quite amusing to see a cat being led around the lobby on a lead!! Our room on the 10th floor was very nice with a great view of San Diego. The bathroom was lovely but the design of the sink did tend to mean everything around it got wet, it looked very nice though! I would definitely recommend joining the Kimpton In Touch loyalty program as it gives you free wifi and a $10 minibar credit. We were reminded of these freebies and the wine hour when we checked in which was a nice touch. The only criticism we had of the hotel was the parking. It is $35 per night, valet only. The thing that really annoyed us about this was the signs outside offering all day (8hrs) parking to the general public for $10, this adds up to $30 for 24 hours which is cheaper than the rate the hotel guests are paying!! We overcame this by parking in the lot across the street (which we could see from our room) for $25 per night, they were also happy to provide in/out passes for 24 hours. Overall, the Solamar is a great hotel in a very good location, we would definitely stay there again if we return to San Diego, but we would continue to park across the street!

Reviews.Title: “splendid Solamar”
Reviews.Author: kate055
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here over Easter we have stayed in Kimptons before but this is the best so far many thanks to the wonderful Wendy and ever helpful Patrick on reception they were so nice. The staff in general are amazing, we askd for a non pet floor and we got top of the house floor 10 over looking the pool, the beds are brilliant they were in the process of replacing the matresses while we were there.The wine reception was a brilliant way of meeting some wonderful people, the only complaint we had was that the fitness gym would need upgraded as there was always a wait , there is a brilliant corner store -deli on 4th avenue and 4st does great breakfast bagels and lunch for a fraction of the [rice called Cine cafe. I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip tp beautiful san diego

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service issue resolved”
Reviews.Author: cello626
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for 1 night at the end of my anniversary celebration. Upon arrival the essentially manditory valet service for our vehicle, at $34 per night was a suprise, (although there is an AAA discount on this). The room and amenities lived up to those promised on the Kimpton website and the rooftop pool/fire pit area was lovely. Our real challenge was in the morning, when the room service we ordered the night before did not come. As we had a 7:45am business meeting, we ended up checking-out without food, and expressed our unhappiness with this at the front desk. Although the initial response of the desk staff was minimal, I received a phone call the following day, in which it was explained that the situation had been researched, staff miscommunication had been idenified, and as recompense, a portion of the charges from our dinner bill during our stay was being cancelled.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: holyjes
Reviews.Content: The rooms are gorgeous, as is the Lobby, the pool deck is stylish and chic. I never wanted to leave!!! Only complaint is no tub in the bathroom but that's the new trend, I guess. I love Kimpton!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Solamar is a warm, welcoming establishment”
Reviews.Author: TheMaj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our 10 year old son spent a week in San Diego during Easter vacation, staying at the Hotel Solamar. From the moment we checked in, I was impressed by the very friendly and helpful staff. Our room was clean, spacious, and offered a view of the 4th floor swimming pool and patio. Free coffee and hot water for tea was available every morning near the front desk, plus an assortment of complimentary newspapers. Nice touch ! The hotel is located in the heart of San Diego's Gas Lamp district which offers a plethora of restaurants and retail stores. Although the Solamar has a restaurant, I would rate the food as average. We stopped in after an evening baseball game hoping for good snacking food, such as burgers, wings, etc. but the menu offerings were slim. The restaurant's bar offers plenty of seating, but prices are a little high. Better to stop into the 7/11 a couple of blocks away... or the corner liquor store to get your adult beverages. Other than being disappointed because of a lack of cuisine variety, my only other negative is the hotel's fitness center...three treadmills, a rack of dumbell weights and a couple of exercise mats. Woefully lacking, for those of us who enjoy a good workout while on vacation. Overall, Hotel Solamar is a very nice place to spend a week.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: timoswatch
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Kimpton, nothing but positive feedback. We have been travelling around and were pleased to finally rest here. The swimming pool on the deck was fantastic, the food was great.

Reviews.Title: “You won't regret it”
Reviews.Author: NCM1982
Reviews.Content: It's in a great location - a few steps from the Gaslamp Quarter (nightlife and restaurants) and a short walk to the baseball park, or the Coronado ferry. Our room overlooked the rooftop bar/pool area - it was a great place to relax after a day of travel. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. Service was excellent. I'd return in a heartbeat. A few fun facts: -the room came with an animal print robe, just for fun! -there is a daily 'free wine' hour in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: mrsscoopy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a quick overnight with my husband on April 22nd. Pros-Upon entering we were warmly greeted by the valet which was great and they really knocked themselves out to help. Room was nice but fairly small, not inspiring lay out. Great shower! Sounds silly but the water pressure was amazing and I could have stayed in all day : ) Cons- the front desk service was pretty cold and we ended up in a room with a pretty unappetizing view (the dirty rooftop and air conditioning). Walls are VERY thin!! About 1am we could hear our neighbors (and their barking dog) in the room next door. I love my dog and all, but I take issue with nice hotels allowing dogs. I could see holiday inn or travel motels but when you go somewhere for a relaxing weekend, I don't want to see or hear dogs everywhere. Restaurant-service great and food plated well but blah. It all lacked flavor. Just a little thing. Thei bathroom in the lobby's soap dispensers were missing their spouts. So soap was dripping all over the granite. Just touches that I think hotels should be on top of. For both of them to be broken off??? Come on. Over all, hotel is just ok. A little dark and not very inviting or warm. Will try somewhere else, next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the sun deck and pool!”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQTraveler
Reviews.Content: I actually loved the entire hotel, but we'd been on the road all day driving from Phoenix, AZ and it was so nice to relax on the sun deck. It's decorated very nicely with plenty of seating and chairs, as well as covered cabanas. The best part was that the pool was super warm, probably over 90 deg. and since it was still just April and not overly hot outside it was so relaxing. I sat on the top step and soaked up the sun. There's also a bar on the sun deck, which was convenient and fun. If you are going to a Padre's game or want to stay in the fun Gaslamp area, I highly recommend the Solamar. The beds were also very comfortable. The wine reception looked fun as well and I noticed they were serving some appetizers too. We didn't get to stay for it or taste the wine, but many guests seemed to be enjoying themselves. Only weird thing was some trash was left by the elevators on our floor and was never picked up, even after maid service had passed through. I got a great deal through Sniquaway and will definitely look for more Kimpton hotels in my future travels.

Reviews.Title: “Elite Kimpton, Super Clean, Chic, Hip, Classy, and Well-Run Staff.”
Reviews.Author: surplusmarketing
Reviews.Content: This was the first time at Kimpton's Solamar Hotel. I booked online under the Sun and Sea internet special which gave me $30 to spend anywhere in the Hotel ranging from in-suite dining/room service to valet parking. As a Kimpton In-Touch member (sign up is Free), i also received a $10 credit to the "Honor Bar" which is the snack and mini-fridge menu. Coming from San Francisco, it was a long drive. I was met by very courteous and attentive valet parking staff. After tipping the valet to take care of my car $5, i was assisted by the bell hop Garrett, who was very friendly and polite. A nice gal name Katie, who had greeted me and checked me in at the Front Desk, had fulfilled by request for a Corner Spa Suite, which when Garrett and i had unloaded my things at the room, was an excellent Corner Unit to say the least. After tipping Garrett $5 for his kind and professional help, I took a tour of the unit. The views were 180 degrees, 9 floors up (10 floors total in this Kimpton) and excellent looking into Petco Park, where the San Diego Padres play home games. There was a roar from the crowds as i was unpacking, as someone from the Padres had just hit a homerun after the 7th inning stretch. Of course, if you could imagine, there were bars around the park next to the Kimpton. There was the Fleetwood and the Bub, right outside the corner suite where you could look down and see the patrons. So if you want a quiet room, either close the windows (you couldn't hear any noise if you shut the windows of this unit and used the A/C) or request a Corner Suite on the other side of the hall. The Corner Suite was spacious and richly appointed. There was a nice, big soaking tub, which was jetted as well. I actually used this Spa jet tub at the end of the night and it just put me to sleep right after. One of the best sleeps i'd enjoyed in a long time. The reason: the beds. These beds like most Kimptons are the most enjoyable beds to sleep on. They are just the right amount of firmness and super clean and fresh smelling. There was a HDTV LCD for viewing enjoyment, a DVD player, liquers available, wine, champagne, Organic cookies, nuts, etc. These Kimptons are inviting and well-thought out. Efficient. Value. Superb service and hospitality at the right value-oriented price point. At least that is the impression i get every time i book and leave a Kimpton. I leave feeling i got a good deal, a wonderful experience, and wanting to book again anytime i'm in a City that has a Kimpton. In fact, that's what i do these days. The Hotel Solamar is one of the most luxurious Kimptons i've booked. The lobby is just spectacular. As with every Kimpton i've stayed at, there was a wine reception hour from 5-6pm. This reception at the Solamar was superb as usual. My female counterpart was extremely delighted. I wholeheartedly recommend yet another Kimpton. The Kimpton Solamar's staff will impress, and once you see the interior decor and stay in the comfortable rooms you will wonder why you only had to pay so little for all of it. By far, of any other hotel chain i've stayed at, the best pound-for-pound all-around deal for its price. These Kimptons are going to devour other hotel chains in this Recession. They will come out of this Recession as a top hotel chain, and to be perfect honest, i think they deserve to me. This benchmark of excellence should apply to all hotels. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't as good as other Kimptons.”
Reviews.Author: claireyaries
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in other Kimpton hotels and although this one was good, it wasn't as good. Location is perfect - right in the heart of the Gaslamp, and the rooms and facilities were ok. But staff weren't as friendly in other Kimptons we've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “a shinning pearl at the gaslamp quarter”
Reviews.Author: sliderTelaviv
Reviews.Content: i have to confence i was in this hotel on nov 2009 , but i recently joined tripadvisor. i went to the hotel with my father, and as much time i had in the hotle ile say that it's beautifull, has a very chick mood. the rooms are very well decorated and very modern. the servise of the hotel was very very good and helpfull, for example i went early in the morning to the pool and without a second past i got a towel and i got a bottle of water. the pool lounge is very good and very fun. i wish i had more time to enjoy the hotel , but i can say it's one of the best iv'e been too. p.s it's close to everyware and it above a few great nught spots.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Grooviest hotel I've ever experienced.”
Reviews.Author: PEteacherandRN
Reviews.Content: Seriously. I'm a big fan of the Ritz-Carlton concierge level. This hotel was truly fun. From the leopard-print robes to the rubber ducky in the ginormous jetted tub, the rooms have it all. I booked a spa king room -- it was large, clean (even for a total germ-o-phobe), and beautifully appointed. I loved the slider that covered the opening to the bath area. Staff is friendly, helpful, and made me feel like I was a family member. No creepy, over-the-top "It's my pleasure." The hosted social hour was so fun -- people actually hanging out meeting each other, engaging in conversation, and even a dog made an appearance! I've never experienced such a comfortable atmosphere. I was traveling here for a conference -- a single woman -- and I always felt safe. Convention center is an easy easy easy walk. YES. I would totally stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Marvin84
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Hotel Solamar. Our room was ready even though we arrived early and the staff throughout our visit was friendly and very helpful.Great location in the Gaslamp District . Free wine tasting in the evening and free coffee and newspaper in the lobby in the morning were a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Zanika2005
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Solamar is a great hotel with excellent service. I stayed at Solamar for 2 nights for a business trip. I had a conference at the Convention Center, which is less than a 2 minute walking distance away from the hotel. (Convention Center parking is $10, not worth it when you can walk). The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was lovely with modern furniture. I stayed on the 7th floor and was able to look out to their fabulous pool and bar on their roof. I liked that it was also very easy to walk around the Gaslamp area. Once I parked my car at the hotel I never used it again! Next time I go back to San Diego I will most definitely be staying at the Hotel Solamar!

Reviews.Title: “In need of attention”
Reviews.Author: dec140
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in beautiful San Diego, shame the Solomar was no treat, in the first few minutes of arriving i could tell the desk team were not organized. Sure enough i was checked into a room that was not ready and the maid was not happy that i was there, that made of us, Awkward! Also the bed was well past its best, i felt springs pushing into my back. Time to invest in new beds. overall a great Kimpton hotel trying to get out but not happening at the moment. Oh i forgot to mention the whole room is for sale, water, food out in the open -very in your face - was worried the bath amenities would be extra! be Wrae

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed with Hotel Solamar”
Reviews.Author: G_AYork
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline Name-Your-Price so once we purchased the hotel, it was too late to change. From the start, we knew it wasn't a place for families but that wasn't even the worst of it. Pros * Great location for Gaslamp district * Close to Petco Stadium and the Convention Centre Cons *Housekeeping was terrible - hotel provides [very] small lotion bottles, after our fist night, I wrote a note requesting housekeeping to leave 2 more bottles for the 2nd days. Not only did they ignore my note but they didn't leave anything the 2nd day. There was dust on the lamp base, the bed was not smoothed out and pillows were not refreshed. Housekeeping didn't hang up the robe, and the side table top was crooked for the entire stay. * No concierge service - must wait for Front Desk to ask about restaurants, sightseeing, etc * No turn-down service * Wine reception served a low quality Cabernet (can't comment on the white wine option) * No airport shuttle service. Other notes: on our check-in, we entered the elevator with one gentleman already on it. Before we reached our floor, he slumped over, hit his head on the rail. I am certain that he had a stroke. At our floor (5), I kept the elevator open and my husband went to find help. I repeatedly pushed the emergency button on the elevator but no help arrived. A housekeeping staff arrived and took the man down and when we asked later, the Front Desk employee made light of the situation and I found out that an ambulance was not called to attend. It was very traumatic for my 9-year old and he refused to take the elevator after that - thank goodness we were only on the 5th floor. The hotel doesn't know what it wants to be. The room decor was a mix of shabby chic, spa fresh and other design elements. It didn't go together. The hotel feels like it wants to be a 4-star but with the lack of service, it is really just a 3-star with a 4/5 star price. If you are a player, traveling on business and looking for a little side action, it might be the place but I don't think anyone who is used to 4+-star hotels will enjoy this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jenlam18
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, super cute decor, good food. This is more than just a nice hotel, the staff actually wants to make sure you enjoy your stay. Pet friendly, which I love, even though I haven't yet traveled with my pets. The bartenders in the JSix bar are awesome, especially Josh. I'll be traveling for work a lot more so this will be my hotel of choice from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and ambiance”
Reviews.Author: msbout
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. I am a big fan of the Kimpton hotel chain and this location is one of my favorites. Centrally located in the Gaslamp district, it is walking distance to everywhere you will want to go ( Shops, restaurants, freeway to Coronado and the convention center). The staff was really top notch with the valet guys really standing out. They brought our car around about 6-7 times over the 3 day period, always opened the door for us and were generally happy to help. Check-in was a breeze with a $10 mini bar voucher :) The room itself was a great size, had a comfortable bed, and a really nice view of the pool. Our only two complaints were that there wasn't any drawer space for clothes, just a closet. The useless piece of furniture in front of the mirror could have been replaced by one. The second was the non-functional pretty bathroom. The sink was sooo annoying. Every time you tried to wash your face the entire sink area would be wet. The shower was also an accident waiting to happen. A large tub but no handles for getting in and out of the shower. If you saw how large this tub was you would understand. Room Service- Turkey burger and fries were okay. The second time we called the estimated time was over an hour and a half. Uh no. The hot chocolate/tea/coffee service in the morning is great along with the wine hour everyday at 5pm. I would highly recommend this hotel and cant wait to come in the summer so I can take advantage of the great pool area/bar.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: drfaust206
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights -- just about everything about this hotel was perfect. The rooms were great, the bathroom is amazing, everything was spotlessly clean, and the staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. They recommended the best taco trucks to get awesome street food from, and were always ready with a smile and small talk. Great location in the Gaslamp Quarter as well -- one block off the main drag, so if you want to be rowdy it's in easy access, but we found the hotel to be perfectly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jala47
Reviews.Content: From start to finish our three days at the Solamar were great. The hotel is lovely. The service impecable.Breakfast at Jsix was delicious. The granola was fabulous! We will surely return. This was our first stay in a Kimpton Hotel. We were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel -- An Extra Note About Value For Conferences”
Reviews.Author: cvg_day_cmh_triad
Reviews.Content: The other reviews do well to describe the great quality of the hotel. I wanted to add that I was staying at the Solamar for a conference at the convention center. The hotel is about a 4 block walk to the convention center -- very close. Plus the room rates were about 30% below the so-called conference hotels. So if you are considering staying at the Hotel Solamar for a conference at the convention center, I highly recommend that you do so. Oh, and Lounge6 is a pretty sweet rooftop lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: imken504
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in January for a business trip. It was truly a wonderful hotel as many reviewers described. The location was great, close to downtown business district; and restaurants in the Gaslamp District. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Friendly staff and great service. I will definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, warm and friendly place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: petie614
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable, elegant yet unstuffy hotel. Friendly, helpful staff, beautiful, comfortable rooms, excellent on-site dining and close to so much. Loved every moment of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Nicola K
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Solamar for a weekend with a group of friends. Great Pool area and bar and very nice rooms and bathroom. Location was fantastic, once we had parked the car it didn't move until we left.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel..great at the right price”
Reviews.Author: orangeeater
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to San Diego..I wanted to stay in the gaslamp district and was drawn to hotel solamar's positive reviews.I stayed 4 nights in a standard room with my girlfriend.. it seemed big enough and she brought a lot of stuff. The bed is very comfy . Shower is awesome.great pressure and hot... liked the shampoo and liquid soap dispensers in the shower. My cons are minor. The gym has 2 treadmills and is tiny. Not a huge deal because one can usually run outside there anyhow. The walls are somewhat thin. Parking is 35 dollars a day..but I knew that going in A big tip is to often recheck the rates.. initially I was locked in at 159 on the hotel website... eventually found it for 126 on Orbitz. Also.. one can often get h.s on hotwire.. I got it for 102 a nite..look for 4 star in gaslamp 95 percent positive reviews with a pool. I would probably give solamar 4,5/5 stars.. can't do 5 stars because for me to give 5 I have to be blown away. But for value..hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, great location, pricy”
Reviews.Author: trippychick2008
Reviews.Content: My honey planned my birthday holiday at the Solamar's Master Suite with "Kuji Soak Tub". The great location is a walking distance to Petco Park, the Convention Center, the Red Car, and Gaslamp District. Our suite had awesome views of the city, Point Loma, and the Coronado Bay Bridge. Complemtary wine and snacks is served in the lobby at 6 p.m. but get there early if you want a seat. There is a nice roof top lounge, but due to bad weather (rain and COLD), there were no takers that weekend. The staff was excellent and helpful and they cater to VIPs (Very Important Pets). They also prove thick leopard pattern robes. The highlight of my trip was soaking in the tub with candles and champagne while watching the rain and enjoying the skylight of San Diego. This is our first stay in a "trendy" hotel and while it's not our thing (we perfer historic/old skool hotels) it was a very nice treat. The downside: You'll have to either order room service for coffee ($5 for a cup) or get your own in the lobby as there is NO in-room coffee pot -a shame for paying $300 a night. The couch was uncomfortable, and there is a $35 per night validated car park. Although the bathroom was outstanding and had the best view of the city, the mirror had streaks on it and the shower is in need of a good scrubdown as it was very slippery. The sink was not practical as water splashed all over yourself, the counter and the mirror. Sadly, our trendy sink had a large crack on the rim and I figure it was caused by a guest that did not have morning Cup of Joe :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for convention”
Reviews.Author: divenski
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in february for a large conference at the convention center. The hotel has clean, very well appointed rooms. The hotel is very convenient to both the convention center and the the Gaslamp district. I also appreciated the free wi-fi. I did not get a chance to go to the free wine tasting, but find this to be a great feature of Kimpton hotels. I would definitely stay here again if I need accommodations in downtown san diego.

Reviews.Title: “BRAVO!!! BRAVO!!! BRAVO!!!”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynNY11230
Reviews.Content: After the Hotel from Hell my partner and I stayed in in Los Angeles, this was such a welcome experience. From driving up to checking out. Jose Adamor was exceptional. He (Jose) ensured that my partner and I started our anniversary off well. Thank you to Jose and to the entire Solomar Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: beck1159
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference in San Diego and we opted to stay at the Solamar rather than the hotel that the conference was at. Good call! The hotel is in a great location in the heart of the Gaslamp District. It is an easy walk to Petco or any great restaurant. The staff was super. We arrived at 11am, and even though we were very early for our check in time, they had our room ready! I requested a room far away from the elevator, and we had an end room! From the JSix Restaurant staff to the staff at the pool bar,and the front desk staff,everyone was very friendly, and called us by name. Our room was very nice. It offered a great view of the city, flat screen TV's, and a very large bathroom with a nice deep jacuzzi tub. The beds were comfy too with lots of pillows. The pool is located on the 4th floor, and although it was cool when we were there, the outdoor bar was open. They had lots of propane heaters to keep you warm. It seemed as though it would be a great place to hang out when it was a bit warmer......lots of cabanas and spots to relax around the pool. We ordered food at the restauran on several occasions, and each time it was very good. Free internet is also a plus when you are a Kimpton In Touch member. Overall, a great place to stay with a super friendly, attentive staff who went out of their way to make sure you lacked for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quick romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: leeshbc
Reviews.Content: I actually live in downtown San Diego but wanted to get away for an evening over V-day weekend. I've stayed or seen many of boutique hotels in the area and this one is one of my new favorites. We booked the Vday package for a pretty decent rate and were happy to find that upon arrival our room was upgraded to one of the jacuzzi rooms at no charge. I liked their jacuzzi tubs as they werent just standard tiny tubs with jets, but the tub was actually pretty spacious and deep. The room decor was beautiful and modern. Service and staff were efficient and pleasant to deal with. Overall, a nice quick romantic getaway in the city (even though i live in the city). Definitely an excellent value for the price we paid. We didn't want to leave. If I had to complain about anything, my bf said he wasnt fond of the burger we had from room service. However, I loved my short ribs :)

Reviews.Title: “nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: number1hedge
Reviews.Content: we had a great stay at hotel solamar! very friendly people, nice rooms, good location, and nice happy hour! the only thing i would complain about, is the high price for drinks out at the pool. all in all, i would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moxsd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel as part of a Valentines Package and it was a great choice. I live in SD and have stayed at most of the top neaby hotels. I would say this one is the best for a few reasons. First, the feeling is more welcoming and less corporate than other hotels. The free wine hour, small boutique feeling, and attentive staff are awesome.I know its against the "rules" but grab your free wine and go to the lounge for the views. Second, The Lounge is really great on the 4th floor, nice staff, good drinks, just a great place to relax. Third, the rooms are nice and clean and have a nicer feeling than corporate generic hotels. I really enjoed the feeling. I had a so so view of the pool but the room was up there with any 4 star hotel. Fourth, location is really great for padres games, bars, lounges, etc. Its within a few blocks of everything and in a very nice area. Really no issues at the hotel that were negative, parking is 35 bucks and thats a little steep but it is a big city. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: SueG66
Reviews.Content: I was there on a business trip. Not only was the hotel room beautiful, so were the staff members. I had a small problem when by boss left the hotel one day early and forgot his passport in his room. I called the front desk from my room and Carly managed to get the passport for me and send it to my room within 10 minutes of my call. I got the passport to the airport 1 minute before boarding. I was so appreciative and so was my boss who absolutely needed to get on that flight. I also want to thank Jose for making me smile every time I walked into the lobby. Actually, the entire staff, starting from the doormen to the maintenance people, were absolutely a joy to say hello to. The service is excellent. This is what Kimpton is all about. Other highlights was that the Conference Center is literally a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “They do the basics, miss the details”
Reviews.Author: BLFootInMouth
Reviews.Content: Had to switch rooms during my stay because there was no king room first night so they put me in a suite just for that night. The suite was awful btw - the "window" was actually a sliding glass door that opened up to the pool and bar (also means it was noisy later than I wanted to be awake. There was almost no light in the suite, and the furnishings were hideous. Transferring rooms mid-stay doesn't work if you had planned to store anything in the safe while out on business... The room where I was transferred was nicer than the suite. Reasonably comfortable. However, no in-room tea or coffee facilities in a hotel advertising that all its rooms have the amenities of home...? Apparently guests are expected to intake caffeine only in the morning, and certainly not in their rooms. That's just wrong. Also I did not understand why a room in San Diego California would be furnished with a duvet on the bed. Duvets work wonderfully in Germany in the winter. But not in SD. You are left with the choice of being very warm or very cold when you sleep. Someone who was obviously not a guest in the hotel - and much larger than me - tried to con me out some cash in the hotel elevator after everyone else had exited. My inner city upbringing saved me there, not Solarmar's security.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: lurkcatty
Reviews.Content: Everything at the Solamar Hotel is top notch. The pool area is great to relax even if you don't fancy a swim. There is a charming lounge area where we enjoyed complimentary wine in the early evening before heading out to sample the local restaurants- abundant and close by. Even the iron is free of the usual polyblend smears left by previous users. Love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff...Great Hotel...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lsr29926
Reviews.Content: Imagine going on a family vacation and each of you gets the flu on separate days. This hotel will send you complementary chicken soup; offer to go get you medicine, all amid a beautiful hotel in a great location. Kudos to the staff and management.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DCWK
Reviews.Content: Great service. Quiet. Friendly. Very clean. Nice swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality (though not the best Kimpton)”
Reviews.Author: adelly
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Solamar for Christmas weekend with my hubby and 2 dogs. Pros: - good location in gaslamp; only a short walk to the major restaurants and bars in the district. - very reasonably priced (I think we only paid $135/night via a special offer) - as with all Kimptons, very dog-friendly (and this is important to us, as this trip was specially for the dogs) Cons: -no other options for parking other than valet (at $35) - front desk failed to advise us during check-in that we had a $10 credit for the mini-bar. Only learned about it as we were being checked out and by then it was too late :( Overall, a good value hotel, very pet-friendly and centrally-located.

Reviews.Title: “Only one short block to the heart of Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: Pearljammer
Reviews.Content: The best feature of this hotel is the LOCATION at 6th and J Street. One very short block to 5th street where all the restaurants, shops, clubs are located but far away enough where there is no excessive noise at night. Last minute reservaation--rates from www.getaroom.com were $124/night for Thu and Fri. Valet parking expensive $35/night. You can literally park your car across the street at 5 Star Parking for $15/night but no In/Out priviledges. Very clean. Beds very comfortable. Staff helpful. Free wi-fi but you have to get the code from the front desk. 24h access to the gym. Complimentary happy hour 5-6pm with wine and bruschetta by the fireplace. Also complimentary coffee (good organic coffee) bar in the morning. Never heard of this "Kimpton" brand of hotel before but apparrently they are VERY pet friendly--saw LOTS of dogs in the hotel. The only "odd" thing I found was the decor--"A shiek attempting to be chic". Sort of 1970's but trying hard to be updated. There is a huge gold wall piece behind the front desk and the entire hotel is dimly lit...as if Saturday Night Live John Travola music should be playing the the background. For the price, location and cleanliness the decor can be overlooked. Would stay here again if I could get the same rate. 4 star hotel. The attached restaurant J Sixx is supposed to be headed by a very good executive chef but we only had dessert there (good) not a whole meal. No complmentary breakfast but "The Broken Yolk" is only half a block away and it was voted "best breakfast place in San Diego"--decent price and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations exceeded in every way possible- exemplary service here!”
Reviews.Author: annienbud2005
Reviews.Content: Its all the little things that count, and Hotel Solamar is great at it! I feel that this will be a more helpful review if I just go through the list. Cleanliness- 5/5 Our room was spotless, and although Hotel Solamar is pet friendly, they do have floors that are entirely pet free. I love both options. My fiance loved the room at Solamar compared our room in Huntington Beach (non-Kimpton hotel, but in the same class), he felt like the design was better, and he even mentioned that the grout was clean in the Solamar bathroom vs HB. Location- 5/5 Located in the Gaslamp Quarter, its a short walk to everything- coffee, food, shopping. The restaurants are a plenty here and Petco park (Padres) are just 2 blocks away. It was far enough to not have to deal with listening to the party all night long, but close enough to walk to the party and walk back. Rooms- 5/5 I touched on this a little bit reviewing cleanliness, our room was spacious, comfortable. Our pillows were amazing and the comforter on the bed had the perfect balance of weight and warmth. I didn't touch the thermostat once. (I stayed in Huntington Beach for 2 nights prior to staying at Hotel Solamar for 2 nights, and the room was a sweat box walking in, but turned into an ice box if you turned on the a/c.) Our shower was nice and pressurized so I could wash the shampoo and conditioner out- very important for the ladies out there. Service- 6/5 Here is where I normally don't expect to have my expectations exceeded. Hotel Solamar staff goes beyond doing their job right, they want to make sure you're happy. Quick good service, helping out others when they are short handed- they care about their job and they care about the hotel, which shows through. I have many stories from my 2 night stay, but I'll just post one(below) and I am a nobody- just a regular Joe schmoe, staying at Hotel Solamar. <I called down for room service at peak time (6:30pm on a Friday night). The phone rang less than 5 times, and the front desk picked it up to let me know the kitchen would have to call me back, they were busy. I figured I'd just call down again in 10 mins or so. Before I could, I did receive a call back, and it was the front desk again. The in-room dining services was busy, but the front desk person offered to take my order and see if he could get it in for me, otherwise he'd have them call me. It felt less than 5 mins, I had a knock on the door. It was room service with my order! I couldn't believe I never had to talk to the in-dining services team once, and I got my order.> It was delicious by the way- I picked their seasonal vegetable ravioli- very good. Value- 6/5 I made my reservations on the Kimpton website- they were offering special pricing, I booked 2 nights for ~$110. Valet parking was $35/day w/in & out privileges, daily for $15. Parking across the street in the lot was $15/daytime, $15/night-time, no in & out, have to pay every 12 hours. I picked valet at the hotel. Sleep Quality- 5/5 I touched on this in the room review above, but the bed was very comfortable, pillows and comforter was perfect. I felt the key is having a good HVAC system, so the room is not too cold/warm- what I appreciated was it didn't blow directly on me/the bed when the fan auto turned on. I hope you travelers out there choose this hotel for your San Diego stay. JSix is a great restaurant, and I wish I could have tried more dishes, but I didn't have enough time. Thank you Solamar!

Reviews.Title: “The only place we stay in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Pinchion
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love this hotel. The staff is always welcoming, the happy hour relaxing, and the location awesome. The area surrounding the hotel is safe and vibrant. There are many great restaurants, including Solamar's JSix within easy walking distance. We have stayed at Solamar many times and two years ago housed all our wedding guests there during our daughter's wedding. Everyone loved it and all were made to feel as if this was their home away from home. The pool and outdoor bar can't be beat and the large gathering area off the lobby is always stocked with newspapers, cold drinks and a fireplace. The rooms are comfortable and bright. As return guests we are made to feel special by the Kimpton Chain as well as the Solamar staff. Because the hotel is located in the heart of activity it can get a little noisy late at night when the bars let out. However, just ask for a room on the quiet side of the hotel. The Kimpton philosophy and the Solamar staff are what makes this a special place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ngah
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights in a room with a king bed on the 8th floor facing the pool. The hotel is cozy, unlike the chain hotels, which made my stay more memorable. They made a very good first impression by allowing me to check in very early. I signed up to be a Kimpton member and was able to receive free Internet, free daily newspaper, and $10 minibar items. There was also free morning coffee/tea and evening wine/sparkling cider. My room was clean, modern-looking, and the bed was comfortable. Check in and check out was fast and friendly. It was only 3 blocks away from the convention center (walking distance) and close to all the restaurants and shopping. The pool can be loud in the evening, especially when there is a large group of people present. They play the music loud as well. I didn't mind so much because after a while, it became background noise to me but my colleague thought it was annoying. A weird thing about this place is that there is not much drawer place for clothes but I did not mind so much. I highly recommend this place and would stay here again. I wish all my hotel stays are like this. Bravo to the hotel managers and staff; they definitely know how hotels should be run.

Reviews.Title: “Solemar went above and beyond,”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravel2011
Reviews.Content: I came in Saturday night to attend a conference. XXXXX Airline lost my bag Saturday night, but I had to present in front of several hundred people Sunday morning at 10:30 a.m. At 8 a.m. Sunday, still no bag from the airline. I asked Carly at the front desk if they could help me find a dress jacket. They called around, and confirmed that there were no stores open at this time on a Sunday morning. Then Carly asked what size jacket I was, and told me I could go to breakfast. 30 minutes later she called me back and told me that she had found a jacket for me. The jacket fit perfectly, and I was able to give a great talk, looking professional -- I also got several compliments on the jacket. Carly had called various staff members, to find one my size, and had been able to borrow a jacket from the Valet Manager for me. This sort of service is just extraordinary. The rest of the visit to the hotel had this same really lovely commitment to personal service.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service”
Reviews.Author: Miracosta
Reviews.Content: Great service everywhere! Valet was friendly and helpful, receptionist was very friendly, too! Everybody seems so happy working there. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelers2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Solamar in January, 2011. We heartily wish it could have been one week or more! The hotel is in the historic Gaslamp District of San Diego. It is beautifully appointed with large and lovely rooms. The lobby is gorgeous and the location is excellent. San Diego boasts numerous great hotels, but this is at the top of our list. We will stay there again when we return to California.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Solamar was an experience in comfort and luxury”
Reviews.Author: animalover4
Reviews.Content: My 19 year old daughter and I vacationed for 4 days and nights at the Hotel Solamar in the Gaslamp Quarter, San Diego. The room was large, quiet and the beds were wonderfully comfortable. The location of the hotel was in the Gaslamp Quarter, adjacent to beautiful art shops, restaurants and clothing boutiques. All of the hotel staff were friendly and helpful, from the concierge to the bell boys. Every time we entered or left the hotel, the door was opened for us. I recommend this hotel who anyone who wants a vacation in a beautiful city and wants to feel pampered.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place I'll stay at in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Razzbelly
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel and I can't imagine staying anywhere else while in San Diego. The staff is amazing and very friendly. They pay attention to your preferences and conversations and remember them throughout your stay. The rooms are modern without being stuffy and the lounge and restaurants are top-notch. Centrally located to many attractions and business needs, this is the perfect place to stay

Reviews.Title: “I'm disappointed Kimpton: What happened?”
Reviews.Author: JetSetLibrarian
Reviews.Content: I'm a Kimpton InTouch member; wherever I travel, I try to stay in a Kimpton Hotel. In fact, one of my favorite hotels is a Kimpton (shoutout to the Burnham Hotel in Chicago!) After staying at a dozen or so Kimptons in half a dozen cities (some cities have more than one Kimpton hotel), I have come to realize that not all Kimpton hotels have the same standards. Sadly, I must put the San Diego Solamar in the "lower standard" category. Maybe it was nicer a few years ago when it was newer; but, it's in decline now. A few positives: central location; coffee in the morning; wine in the early evening; free NY Times (even Sunday edition); outdoor patio; good wireless reception throughout building; nice enough front-desk staff. Now for the not-so-positive: the mattresses are old and need replacement (or flipping): there are large indentations from where people have slept. The rooms are spare: perhaps this isn't much of an issue except that Kimpton touts itself as being stylish--hotel pictures show a lovely room with pillow shams and blanket throws but, the rooms no longer contain these items. Also, cabinet doors didn't close properly because the hinges were loose and worn. The carpet leading into the room was bare and torn. These small things contributed to an overall feeling of decline; maybe the room was pretty nice five years ago but now it seems a little bit shabby. Another negative: I'm a Kimpton InTouch member and the paper wasn't delivered to my door. Again, this is a small thing but 1) this is a service that Kimpton touts and 2) small things like this add up to a general sense of dissatisfaction. All in all, I would not put the Solamar into the category of two stars, but it seems to be slipping into it. Kimpton needs to put this hotel onto the list of "hotels to refurbish".

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotel Experiences Ever”
Reviews.Author: Rockinrodd
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing experience at this hotel. We drove to San diego on a whim, got in late had no idea where we were going to stay. We were tired from a long drive in from a long weekend in Vegas and just wanted a nice place to stay. After checking out a few other hotels, we pulled into Hotel Solamar. The valet was prompt and courteous, the front desk staff were so helpful from check in to city must-do recommendations. The hotel is beautiful and I love that they allow dogs - we will consider bringing ours on our next trip. As we settled in our room to clean up for a night on the town, the most amazing music bellowed from the roof top as a wedding reception was going on. The wine in the evening, the coffe in the morning just added to the experience. I loved the sassy waiter in the hotel restaurant with the real scoop on what to see and do. The location is fantastic for checking out Gaslamp. I could go on and on, but bottom line- it was one of the best hotel experiences ever. We hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: tommy25
Reviews.Content: Just finished a wonderful stay at this hotel with my family. We stayed over New Year's wtih our little kids. The location is great - in the heart of the Gas Lamp district and close to the convention center and many restaurants. I have never had more friendly/helpful valets and hotel staff at a hotel as I have experienced during this stay. The rooms were comfortable and decently sized. Valet parking was $35 per day - so we instead parked further down the street at an ACE parking garage which worked well and cost $17 per day. The hotel had great coffee in the lobby each morning and we absolutely loved the wine hour (each night between 5 and 6pm). We asked for a quiet room - and ended up on the 8th floor. The pool deck was really loud over new year's eve from the party there - but we expected that. The hotel staff were great for restaurant recommendations. We ate at the Tin Fish - good fish and chips. Broken Yolk - excellent breakfast - right next to the hotel - we highly recommend this place (I think it was even featured on Man vs. Food. Rockin Baja Lobster restaurant - awful food and service - but loud enough to have to eat there with our kids. Joe's Crab Shack - was fine. Saffron - (on India street) excellent Thai takeaway - especially the grilled Thai chicken - great if you have a car. A few cons though: 1) Expensive valet fees 2) The room smelled a little funny. 3) My wife's allergies acted up during our stay - prob because this is a very pet friendly hotel. After some claritin, she was fine though. 4) No locks on the bathroom doors - I don't get this. Is this a boutique hotel thing? Overall, we loved our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just One Great night”
Reviews.Author: EdwardG
Reviews.Content: My spouse won an evening at the Hotel. This boutique hotel had nice modern sized rooms, responive help, friendly environoment, and good San Diego location. Since departing they sent survey and we responded in a positive manner. Great location if your attending a meeting or conference in SD convention centre. We had a relaxing time and enjoyed the short get a away in one of America's finest cities. . .

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel near the Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: SBBetsy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel sight unseen on Hotwire for $69 and were delighted to discover a gem just a block from the heart of the Gaslamp quarter. The decor is elegant and beautiful in the lobby, hallways, and rooms. Sleek modern fixtures in a navy blue bathroom... simple but stunning modern multimedia art...really special. The room was very comfy. Staff was sharp, accomodating, and very friendly without being overbearing. Best of all, they love dogs here and welcome them by name as "VIPs" on the chalkboard at the front door. It's a very short walk to the Gaslamp district and the baseball field, a bit further to the convention center. This is a charming hotel and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with personality”
Reviews.Author: PinaColada02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a 4 day business trip and was very satisfied with the hotel. I've stayed in several Kimpton hotels and I am never disappointed. The hotel is in a great location right in the Gaslamp district and you can walk to many different restaurants. The hotel had some nice guest perks like free coffee and chai tea bar in the morning, free afternoon hot chocolate bar, free evening wine reception. My room was spacious, very clean and nicely decorated with touches that were inspired by the locale. As a Kimpton InTouch member, I was treated very well. Prior to my arrival I received an email from someone on guest relations saying they were looking forward to my stay and asking if I needed anything prior to arrival. There was a note from the hotel in my room offering me $10 to raid the mini bar. I even got a hand written note from the cleaning woman. I ate in the hotel's outdoor bar/lounge on my first night and the food and cocktails were great. I even got a huge discount on my food by checking in on Foursquare. I used the gym 3 out of the 4 days I was there and it was clean. My only complaint is that the temperature in the gym was very hot. Also on one of the nights, it was loud late into the night and I couldn't tell if it was a guest in an adjacent room or people in the outdoor pool/bar area. I eventually fell asleep so it wasn't a huge deal. Also if you are a dog lover, you will love this hotel but more importantly if you are not, like me, you will still enjoy your experience. When I first checked in it was around the time of their daily dog happy hour and there were dogs all over the lobby area. I immediately was turned off as I am not a dog person but the manager assured me I was on a pet-free floor and that the dog happy hour is only a short time in the afternoon. Since I left the hotel in the morning for work and didn't come back until the early evening, it never became an issue as I never did see another dog. Overall I loved the hotel and will definitely stay there when I return to San Diego for another trip, and I will of course keep staying at Kimpton hotels whenever possible. They truly do offer a unique experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic All Round”
Reviews.Author: jays4
Reviews.Content: The staff, the decor, the location were just what we needed for our 4 day stay in San Diego. We arrived early for check-in and a family member wasn't well and they got us into a room asap and recommended a change to a room on Level 4 near the pool due to having children with us - great move and the room was spacious and just what we needed. It was not noisy as we stayed from Sunday to Thursday and our children loved the heated pool area which we had mostly to ourselves. The restaurant is OK - food delicious - one waiter just needs to be more welcoming. Once again location is near everything and San Diego city blocks are small and you don't need a car. Pets were cute and the hotel welcomed them. The free coffee bar and afternoon wine hour were very popular.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location for seeing San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Occidental2urist
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Solomar in San Diego prior to our cruise. Great location for sightseeing. walked to Seaport Village and the USS Midway, also walked to Trolley Tour, bought a day pass and went to Coronado. Lots of great restaurants and shops nearby. Even walked to Steeler bar nearby for Sundays game. Hotel staff was great. Beds very comfy. Would stay there again. Bonus complimentary wine hour every day and organic coffee in the lobby each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: tap6699
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a night at the Solamar before a Mexican cruise and it was one of the best hotel stays we have experienced. We arrived early afternoon and because we had joined the Kimpton loyalty program (In Touch) we had a standby upgrade to a virtuoso suite for $20. Unfortunately our room wasn't ready but due to the inconvenience we were given complimentary drinks and nibbles in the restaurant to the value of $50. It was only a minor inconvenience as our room was ready within 30 minutes or so. The room itself was a good size with 2 TVs, $10 mini bar credit as a result of being an in Touch member. Nice bathroom with jacuzzi bath and really big comfortable bed. Kimpton have a free wine hour with canapes at 5pm and this was a really nice touch as we got free wine which is always good but also gave you an opportunity to chat to other guests. The hotel is pet friendly but you wouldn't know it as there are no 'pet smells'. There is a beautiful bar and pool area on the 4th floor and a small gym. The hotel location is excellent, right in the middle of the gaslamp district which has loads of bars and restaurants, felt really safe. We even found a secret bar, Vin de Syrah, which was recommended to us by one of the other guests during wine hour which was a really cool place. We had breakfast at the broken yolk cafe which was a few doors down, amazing portions and good tasty food, although service was a bit slow. We had dinner in the Royal Thai Restaurant on 5th Avenue which was really good. Would also recommend the zoo if you have time, we had a couple of hours in the morning and went to see the pandas but you could spend all day there, great zoo and beautiful location and surroundings. Would thoroughly recommend the Solamar as a great place to stay for the service and location which are both excellent. All the staff were friendly and the little extras make it a really welcoming place. Special mention to Jose who really looked after us during our stay, fantastic guy who couldn't do enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, but no in-room coffee”
Reviews.Author: RHooft
Reviews.Content: I liked the location, clean room, good reading light/chair, free, no-hassle WiFi and LAN cable, functional desk with power strip, friendly, helpful staff. Did not like: No in-room coffee (made do with hot water and instant coffee from nearby CSV). Breakfast only at 7 am ("Broken Yolk" next door opens at 6 am).

Reviews.Title: “I'm picky and I love this place”
Reviews.Author: floradivine
Reviews.Content: Ideally located in the Gaslamp neighborhood, this clean modern hotel had everything I needed and more. Here's what I especially liked: - the room was larger than I expected and both beds were queens, not doubles! - our room on the top (10th) floor was extremely quiet. I'm a very light sleeper and I was only awakened one night out of four by loud guests talking as they walked down the hall. - The doors don't slam as loudly as in most hotels. - Free fresh brewed coffee in the morning and free wine from 5-6 in the lobby. - It's pet friendly but it was very clean and quiet, not like some pet friendly hotels. And the top 2 floors are pet-free. - Fast elevators - Extremely helpful staff (it appears they hire only attractive young men, and we had no problem with that) - Rooftop pool and bar is beautiful. Access it from 4th floor - The Broken Yolk is a great place for breakfast. Less than 1 block away - If you become a Kimpton member, wireless is free The only thing I didn't like was the overly large pillow. I got a stiff neck. I never went into their restaurant, but it looked nice. I will stay here again next time I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: someonesomewhere24
Reviews.Content: I loved the trendy contemporary style of this hotel! I stayed for a week for a business conference at the Convention Center. The hotel is only 3 blocks away from the Convention center and right in the Gaslamp Quarter which is the best place to stay when visiting San Diego. I stayed downtown toward the end of my trip and it was like night and day. Hotel Solamar feels new and clean. Downtown does not and it is noisy. My room felt relatively clean and cozy but not tiny. The ambiance of the hotel was great. They have a wine hour in the evenings and provide complimentary coffee/tea each mornings. Lots of restaurants and shops in the Gaslamp Quarter. The staff is very friendly and welcoming at Hotel Solamar. Become a Kimpton InTouch Member for free Wi-Fi and daily newspaper delivery (membership is free). My room had a 40" flat screen tv, dvd player, and queen bed. The rooms felt pretty clean and very cozy. I requested a high level room (10th floor which is the highest) facing the pool. It was great! Don't face the pool if you don't like noise, at nights it can get a little noisy but I didn't mind. The pool and lounge were very modern and upscale. I enjoyed the ambiance. There is late night room service as well. They're very eco-friendly and pet-friendly too. The only issue I had was that they charged my debit card for the total bill at check-in and no one told me (I meant to give them my credit card). I thought it was solely for incidentals, etc like every other hotel. I happened to check my account and before the charge could overdraft my account, Sharon from the accounting department resolved the issue within minutes. She was very willing to help reconcile this issue and I was very impressed. Otherwise I really enjoyed my stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Was not what I had hoped:(”
Reviews.Author: Trent1979
Reviews.Content: I had been looking forward to visiting San Diego for quite some time and had researched quite a few hotels in the Gaslamp Quarter before deciding to book the Solamar. I had arranged this stay for a group of my friends and family who were travelling together and I really liked the fun, yet sophisticated and stylish look of the hotel from pictures I had seen online. It was our arrival at the the hotel that I feel disappointed me most. We were a group of 8 persons checking-in at around 3pm in the afternoon - I had sent an email to the hotel advising them 2 members of our group were members of the Kimpton In Touch program and I had advised their membership numbers. It was evident the membership numbers were not in our reservations upon check-in, even though I had sent the email 2 weeks prior. My sister enquired about arranging a massage while we were checking in and the person at the desk suggested she join the Kimpton In Touch program to gain a discount? My sister was one of the persons in our group who I had advised the hotel was already a member! After being allocated our rooms I went up to mine. I called reception when I got inside as I had wanted a room with a walk-in shower rather than a shower over the bath. The person I spoke to, who was the same person that checked me in said that they could move me and my partner and advised I bring all our bags down to reception where they would give me the key to our new room. I double checked with them they could move us, as my partner was dropping off our rental car and I was going to have to move all the luggage back down stairs myself to change rooms, the person confirmed yes I was to do this. When I got down stairs the person who I was speaking with on the phone was with another guest and I told their colleague what I was advised. I immediately felt as though this request to change rooms was unreasonable, there was some huffing and they checked on the system where they could move me too. After a couple of minutes they advised there was no other room to move me to - it had already been allocated. I said can you please check with your colleague as they had confirmed there was another room just 5 minutes ago. The person I was dealing with advised me again there was no other room. At this point I was annoyed, but thanked them for their assistance and went back up to my original room. When my partner got back I told him what had happened and he called down to reception, he asked to speak with the manager and was told sorry the manager is on vacation at the moment? We were confused a hotel of this standard had nobody in charge while the manager was on vacation? Generally this hotel is attractive and nicely decorated. The service like in many "trendy" boutique hotels, lets it down though. I have stayed in Kimpton hotels prior to this stay at the Solamar and had had better experiences than this. I think for the price you probably could get better value for money in the Gaslamp Quarter I am sorry to say.

Reviews.Title: “nice, contemporary hotel, but service did not match the star rating”
Reviews.Author: travelcowcow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in the Gaslamp district. From the airport, the driving time was about 15 mins. Be warned that the hotel does not have a designated self park, and valet parking is somewhere around $35 per day. We were able to find free parking at parking meters around the hotel every night except for Saturday when the nightlife in the district was very busy. After being stuck in traffic and circling around for a couple times, we ended up parking in a parking lot several blocks away for $15 overnight. There're restaurants and boutique shops around the area, in daytime the area is pretty quiet. We went to Coronado, SeaWorld, SD zoo, wildlife animal park, legoland, etc... All within close driving distance. Farthest we had to drive to the destination was probably 40 mins. We liked the ambiance and interior design and layout of the hotel. However, we were disappointed with the service. The housekeeper did not do a good job with keeping up with supplies in the room. Everyday, there was something missing: it was either toilet paper, or lotion, or other random things. When we did ask for the supply, it would take a long time for the items to arrive to our room. It also seems like they didn't put much effort making the bed. Apparently the hotel maid did not like re-arranging the pillows; the pillows were left at the corner of the bed every day when we returned to hotel. I guess the maid just didn't bother putting that finishing touch. The nice part of the hotel is that there's complimentary coffee and tea everyday in the lobby. However, the staff who's responsible for maintaining the station looked like she was about to kill someone. It wasn't hard to tell she hated her job. When I was at the station making my tea, I guess I was in her way and she just stood there staring at me with an attitude. I looked back and asked if I was in her way, she just said no and went away to do something else... Pretty unusual experience for a hotel with this star rating. There is a complimentary wine hour at the hotel too, I believe it was from 5-6. We've never tried it because we were always out doing something. Despite the negative experience with the housekeeping and unfriendliness of staff, I wouldn't mind staying at this hotel again if I can book at the same rate again ($99 per night through Hotwire). It is good value given the location and cleanliness of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but idiosyncratic”
Reviews.Author: MDtraveler001
Reviews.Content: The Solamar is a boutique type hotel in the gaslight district of San Diego, 3 blocks from the convention center, good location. The rooms were nice, the service excellent, nice wine reception each evening, rooms quiet, but a few caveats/ peculiarities. 1) No chest of drawers/ shelves in the rooms. 2) There are a few shelves in the large closet but latter hard to access because the door opens to only part of it . 3) No bar soap in the bathroom, only liquid dispensers. 4) Only 1 towel bar in the bathroom. 5) Nothing to hold onto getting in/out of shower/bath. 6) no in room coffee although available in lobby. 7) Fitness center totally inadequate with just a couple of treadmills and one elliptical, a few free weights. They do offer a $15 day pass to a nearby club. If your own center is that bad, the pass should be free. Wi fi access is free if you join the Kimpton club. If you're looking for a smaller alternative to the large chains, consider this if you can live with the above.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Priced, Located, and Fab Service”
Reviews.Author: sanfrann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our teenaged daughter spent the weekend for my son's SD university Parents' Weekend. We ended up spending more time at this fun boutique hotel than on campus, and my son opted to stay with us in our hotel. The hotel is chic, the service wonderful, the food from both room service and the restaurant was first rate, and the location right next to Petco Park and one block from the main drag was perfect. The 4th floor rooftop pool was so nice - away from the noise of the street, but enough going on (there's also full screen TVs in the rooftop bar to watch the Giants win the pennant) Our room actually faced the bar/pool which made me a tad anxious as to noise, but we heard nothing whatsoever. We walked everywhere, and had rented a Prius, so the overnight parking fee was cut in half (take note if you're staying - the parking rate is $35 which seems like a lot but all the downtown hotels charge the same - there is a public lot across the street for $20, but with the hybrid car rate of $17.50 we had somewhat of a bargain) Also to note: dogs are welcome - there were 5 or 6 staying, but we rarely saw them, and were glad when we did. (Heard no barking.) Something else to note about downtown San Diego in general: LOTS of homeless around (and I'm from San Francisco!) but it seems they mainly hang out down near Broadway - very sad.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: patsfan14
Reviews.Content: Went to San Diego for a long weekend to go see the Patriots play the Chargers. Chose the Solamar for it's location right in the middle of the GasLamp district. What a perfect location, close to bars, restaurants, the trolley and bus lines to go to the Zoo or Old Town. Plus the pool bar on the 4th floor is amazing. Great atmosphere and service!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE everything about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: leetlesasa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night with the boyfriend - turned his boring business trip into a fun night in a great city! Check-in was fast and the guy at the front desk was very friendly. He gave me a few suggestions for shopping / things to do while the boyfriend did his business thing. Stayed in the masters suite and it is HUGE with a great layout. The honor bar is fully stocked (though not enough wine, haha) and although the bathroom is huge, I was bummed about the built-in toiletry dispenser. Just don't think its a good look for the hotel but cuts back on wee plastic bottles and this is a green hotel after all. Our favourite part about the hotel (about any hotel, really) is the poolside bar. Friendly bartender, makes a mean dirty martini, and kept my champagne glass full at all times. Lots of places to sit/stand and you can tell this place gets wild on weekends. Started chatting up with a few cool chicks and they invited us to a bar next door (cannot for the life of me remember the name of it but it was definitely the place to be) After a looong night of drinking and dancing, we were so happy to have a big comfy bed to get back to (and a pull-out couch for some of our new party-buddies) The location is perfect, lots of shoppings/ restaurants/ bars within walking distance. I will absolutely stay here again when I get the chance - or at least visit the bar!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel In San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Pearlllama
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip to San Diego and brought my family with me. We stayed at this hotel and had an absolutely fantastic experience. We stayed here because the hotel has a room with two queen beds - perfect for a couple with a 5 and 7 year old. The hotel is modern, clean, near the convention center and a step away from the hopping nightlife and shopping of the gaslamp district. The pool area is beautiful and looked like it would be a fun place to kick back and relax. I plan on staying there next time I have a business trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Always a problem”
Reviews.Author: lotsobiztravel
Reviews.Content: Everytime I have been here there has been a problem of some sort. it is a beautiful hotel w/an unimpressive restaurant and room service. Although the hotel is funky and fun looking - they are unorganized. This time we didn't have a remote for our TV, they brought a 2nd one that didnt work and had to send up an engineer twice, just for a remote. Room service was expensive & also unimpressive (and wrong).....then at checkout when the valet brought us our car we had a PARKING TICKET on the windshield. I thought they had their own lot!!! They actually parked our car somewhere where it got ticketed. They obviously said they would pay it, but that is it, I've given it 2 tries.....no more.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, well appointed hotel conveniently located near the Gaslamp area”
Reviews.Author: mardypunk
Reviews.Content: We arrived here after a very long journey from Yorkshire to London by train then flying from London to LA then driving to San Diego.....and, after following the very good directions from the website, when we arrived at the hotel we were met with great service. The chap at check in told us about the roof top bar and pool, when and where the coffee was served in the morning and about the wine tasting in the evening. The room was beautifully decorated....the bed was very comfy with a heap of pillows and we had a lovely view of the pool. We were planning on using the hotel parking at $35 per night....but there is a car park directly opposite which only cost us $25 for 2 nights. The car park was manned, busy and had CCTV so we were happy to leave the car there. We walked from this hotel to Balboa park and the Zoo which took about 30 mins, we really enjoy stretching our legs and walking, but I'm sure it would be a very straightforward drive too. Walking to the Gaslamp area on an evening only took a few minutes and there were plenty of restaurants and bars to choose from. I would definitely stay at the Hotel Solamar again if visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “I'd have to think about it.”
Reviews.Author: BeachSeeker2009
Reviews.Content: We arrived at HS to find a backup at Check-In. The computers were down and okay, that happens. However, by the time we came back after dinner and the computers were up again, we got our room cards and that was it. No one told us about the amenities of the hotel and I didn't know about the beautiful pool and rooftop bar until I happened on it the next evening. Even worse, after I had discovered it on my own HS closed this great asset for a private function on Sunday Afternoon/Evening.
