Sorry, but when I pay to stay in a hotel I expect to have access to all of the hotels assets during my stay. Also, I like dogs but I didn't expect to see them in a downtown boutique hotel. On the other hand, the room was very nice & clean, the location is excellent for walking access to The Gaslamp and the waterfront, the staff was very friendly and the complimentary wine and nibbles at cocktail hour is a nice touch. All in all I was satisfied with Hotel Solamar but I think I'll try another boutique hotel on my next trip to San Diego before going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice comtemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelertoo93
Reviews.Content: Great hotel decor, rooms are nice and clean. Also, nice guest hour featuring complimenary wine.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: leasingprincess
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Solamar is an absoutely beautiful hotel. The staff is friendly and very accommodating. The rooms are a very nice size, the restaurant is good and the bar nightlife is fun! I was there on business. The close proximity to the convention center was important to me and as a woman, I felt very safe walking to and from the convention center and the Gaslamp District for food and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Fun, Convenient Gaslamp Stay”
Reviews.Author: Brian Thomas
Reviews.Content: Yet another convention, yet another hotel. Nicely styled place with hip lobby and afternoon wine hosting makes for good start to the night. Pleasant rooms with view of the baseball park and interesting pool bar on a higher floor. There was a fun wine-tasting even when we visited in the bright sun by the pool. The rooms are well appointed with full honor bar and slick bathrooms. Quiet upper floors with opening windows. Great location. Nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Gaslamp Hotel”
Reviews.Author: crsdmale
Reviews.Content: When visiting San Diego, the Hotel Solamar is a hotel you must consider for your stay. The most obvious reason to consider them is their ideal location in the Gaslamp Quarter. You can have your choice of dozens of different restaurants within a couple of blocks of the front door. They are also a couple of blocks from the Padres stadium and within walking distance of the waterfront attractions. Beyond the location, the staff coulnd't have been nicer. We were checked in right away and given all of the info about the complimentary wine hour and afternoon iced tea and lemonade, as well as given maps and information regarding the neighborhood. Then every time we came back to the hotel, we were greeted with a smile and hello. One other nice touch if you are someone who likes travelling with your dog, the Hotel Solamar is the pet friendliest hotel I have ever stayed at. The Hotel Solamar goes out of their way to make you feel welcome and provides a relaxing place to come back to after a day in the San Diego sun.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in a perfect place”
Reviews.Author: skeeboy
Reviews.Content: Staff here was more than helpful, very friendly, and just plain efficient. Liked the touch of the water bowl & chalkboard out front welcoming the visiting pooches. Only drawback, albeit minor, was the tiny workout area. I guess you can go down the street to workout if so inclined, but it would be nice to have it on-site. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel.....only let down by the staff”
Reviews.Author: Phil1978
Reviews.Content: Visted San Diego and Hotel Solamar on the First Leg of our Honeymoon and were looking forward to visiting as we base our Hotel choices solely on reviews of Trip Advisor. Arrived on Labor Day (national holiday apparently?) the day after our wedding and after two flight totally 13hrs and needless to say shattered at around 5pm only to find our room wasn't ready and we would have to wait 10-15mins for it to be ready, that then turned into 30mins and got told we could relax by the pool and they would let us know when it was ready, headed to the pool which was pumping music like a beach party, no problem as we were just happy to find a seat, 45mins later we headed back down and then got told that he by the same receptionist that it would be would only another 15mins as he had been dealing with something else, finally at just after 6 we got our room throughout the saga, we were almost made to feel like we were to blame. The Hotel and the room itself were fantastic and the quality and cleanness of the room were top quality and couldn't be faulted, we had a bottle of champagne and a happy birthday card???? Which magically later in the day to a Comgratulations card! Which was a nice touch. One of the first things we did find however was that the safe didn't work, which with our passports and cash etc we sure needed. Reported on the phone and were told we could go out and Maintence would repair, that evening when got back it still wasn't fixed, so called again in the morning to ask again and when still not repaired that evening asked reception for 3rd time. Still wasn't repaired so gave up asking!! wine hour was a nice touch, was served most evenings by a lady from the phillipenes who was lovely whenever we saw her, unfortunately on the Tuesday after a long day at the Zoo, there was a older blonde lady serving who was simply Rude and was possible the rudest person we came across, at first we thought she disliked us for bring a younger crowd, however when speaking to other guests in the lift we weren't the only people to notice this. The pool area itself was lovely and offered lovely views over the Gaslamp, unfortunately service wasn't much better when we did visit with the barman being more interested in the baseball game on, than any customers. finally when we did get home to the uk, we checked our credit card statement to find we'd been double billed for our stay, so after long call trying to get someone to help from within the hotel a voicemail was left and the problem that should never happen was resolved quickly. Overall we lovely San Diego, the Hotel we loved and the rooms were lovely, the Valet staff were friendly and the cleaning staff very nice but unfortunately too much poor customer service soured our visit. Especially constant failings over the safe problem and the rude blonde wine lady. We don't ask much where we stay, just a clean room and friendly, smiling and helpful staff, Hotel - Great, Staff.....Customer Service courses needed for many, I suppose what you pay is what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Impeccable Service, Truly First Rate”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal019
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. The room was clean and very tastefully decorated. The ambiance of the public areas is high class. The staff was incredible. We were always greeted by name, and they sent up wine and chocolates for our anniversary. We had a delicious dinner at jSix, with the staff going above and beyond for our celebration. As it is in the heart of Gaslamp Quarter, the fun going on outside could be heard until late, which made me want to join it! But the cozy, comfy bed made up for it. The hotel is so conveniently located that we could walk to anything. We had a wonderful time, and would go back, and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Margo29
Reviews.Content: we travelled through California and stayed here for 2 nights ...the hotel is beautiful and the staff are 'the best' especially Kelsey ( front desk ) and Elena ( wine hour hostess) . The location is terrific .We celebrated our 37th anniversary while staying here and Kelsey made us a card and sent some fab Californian Merlot and chocolate dipped cherriesz to our room for us. I would def rec. this hotel. Oneminor area for improvement is the floor surface around the pool bar area ..it could do with a thorough clean .

Reviews.Title: “Best ever”
Reviews.Author: jock_potts
Reviews.Content: Because of a double booking we we're sent to the beautiful but noisy (club downstairs playing "Thud music" til 2.00am) Hotel Se' San Diego for our first night.The complimentary breakfast was great as were the staff in the restaurant.When we arrived back at Solamar we were given one of the best suites in the hotel(complete with jacuzzi).Jose the concierge was very apologetic about the booking problem and did everything in his power to make us welcome including giving us complimentary breakfasts every morning,a note of apology a bottle of wine and snacks were waiting in our room on arrival.Thanks Jose you are a star.I can't fault this hotel or its excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not an obvious choice for kids, but thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: RS11
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay downtown so chose this hotel as it sits in the gas lamp quarter. Travelling with kids (7 & 10) we shared a large room... not ideal but our choice and the room was fine. The kids loved the rooftop pool and whilst it is co-located with the smart hotel bar, which was particularly popular with the trendy younger set, this was fine and at no point did the kids feel unwelcome (not that they would notice anyway!). We used the hotel as a base to visit SeaWorld and the Zoo both of which were terrific and pretty close. In the evenings we ate out locally - there were plenty of excellent restaurants nearby. The only downside is the hotel restaurant - we had breakfast included and so forced ourself to endure the unprofessional, haphazard service. That excluded, all other staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a stay in the heart of the Gaslamp Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: Shar83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, and absolutely loved the ambience of this hotel. The public areas as well as our room were clean, spacious and very nicely decorated and the staff is very friendly. The location is great, right in the middle of the Gaslamp, with many nice restaurants and shops at walking distance. Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends!

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed, really.”
Reviews.Author: leclaire68
Reviews.Content: It's been a few years since we've stayed in a Kimpton property and we've had a favorable impression of them all along. We were looking forward to staying at The Solamar in San Diego while visiting family and were especially appreciative of Kimpton's marketing efforts and special programs for GLBT visitors. The chain is to be applauded for that. This specific hotel, though, was a bit of a disappointment. Like a previous reviewer noted, some of the disappointments were minor (most were, actually) and some were down-right frustrating for a hotel of this quality. Valet parking anywhere in a major metropolitan area is expensive. We did gulp a bit at the $35/night valet rate. In general valet attendants were efficient and friendly. A couple, however, were abrupt with comments like, "Call earlier. It'll be 15-20 minutes before we can get your car." During the time we stayed at the Solamar the property appeared to be at capacity, yet they were down to just one elevator. This created incredible lines for the lift in the lobby and on each floor of the hotel ... day and night. When we inquired about the location of the stairway, we were given a vague response. We finally found the stairway, but kind of shook our heads at the lack of attention to service. As many have noted, the pool area is superb. It was fun to hang out there on a Friday night, people watch, enjoy a cocktail, and enjoy the sunshine. Again, some staff members were friendly and professional, others were surly or aloof. Our king guest room was on the smallish side, but the most concerning piece of the room itself was the incredibly uncomfortable bed. I spend about 70% of my time on the road and am very accustomed to lots of variation in hotel bedding. This was the worst bed I've had in months and reminded me of beds I encounter when I'm stuck in motel in some small berg in the middle of nowhere. It sagged tremendously on the sides, provided no support, and produced a very uncomfortable night's sleep for both of us. The lack of bath soap, etc in the bathroom didn't bother us. In fact, I appreciate that the hotel uses pump shampoo, conditioner, and body wash instead of individual soaps and bottles of liquids. It's much more ecological. The bathroom did, however, have a lingering mildew smell. We couldn't find any mildew, but it was definitely on the nose. In actuality, the bathroom decor is gorgeous, but not all that functional. The sink, for example, is quite modern but does not drain well (due to design, not a plumbing issue) and splashes water all over the place. The toilet paper, as another reviewer mentioned, is scratchy, but we accepted this as the hotel uses an ecological toilet paper product. As another reviewer mentioned, too, we were baffled by the lack of a hotel guide in the guest room, a TV channel guide, or even a pad of paper and a pen. Checkout was painfully slow and inefficient. I waited and waited for a charge from the hotel's restaurant (JSix) to show up on our folio, even though it had been a hour since we left the restaurant. The hotel staffer just kept asking me to wait and she would check the folio in between helping other guests. There had to be a better way to handle this. We wanted to like Hotel Solamar, we really did. Unfortunately, it won't be on our list of choices when we return to San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “I love Kimpton hotels”
Reviews.Author: DaveNBPT
Reviews.Content: I admit up front, I'm a sucker for Kimpton hotels. I've also stayed in their DC property, and enjoy the young vibe, funky style, and elegant modernism of the hotels. Solamar did not disappoint. We stayed on the top floor in a corner room and it was perfect. Everything was cozy, clean and comfortable. The bed was a little too lumpy and soft for both mine and my wife's tastes, so our sleep wasn't as comfortable as we would've liked. The pool area on the 4th floor was wonderful to enjoy. We had lunch there and a few frozen cocktails. Were a bit astounded at the price of the cocktails when we got the bill though -- you do pay for all of that style. So maybe forgo the alcoholic drinks here and enjoy them in one of the many fine, local restaurants. A nice touch is they'll print out and display a photo you send them ahead of time to make you feel more at home. One of those personal touches that anyone could do on their own, but since they thought of it, it made it seem even more special. The Internet was fine. The only tiny thing was the designers who insist on using sliding doors in bathrooms (when there was plenty of room in this room for a regular door). Sliding doors are great for doors you don't open or close very often, because they tend to be harder to open and close, and if not perfectly aligned, they don't always close tight. Case in point was in our room, where there was a very noticeable crack when the bathroom door was closed because the door was no longer level. A minor annoyance, but one endemic of many 4 star properties. If you need to be in this area of San Diego, I would heartily recommend the Solamar. You're treated like you're special because you are!

Reviews.Title: “Another great Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: Easy_Going_SF
Reviews.Content: I stay here everytime I come for the Camp Pendelton Mud Run (annually) and it's always a pleasure. The staff is easy going, accommodating and generally nice. The rooms, despite having somewhat funky decorating, are set up really well. The location can't be beat, in the heart of the Gas Lamp district. The only issue I have is the cost of parking, which is geared toward obtaining revenue from baseball games. You just need to add it into the price of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: HorrisScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Solamar for 3 nights in early August. After reading reviews on here we left our hire car parked up for nearly 3 days at the car park about 300 metres further down the same street (and same side) as the Solamar, and total cost was about $15, so no worries about having a car. Nice modern hotel, spacious rooms and nice pool. Hotel also does a wine hour from 5-6 which was nice to come back to after a day out. Our rate included continental breakfast which was served in the hotel restaurant and was very nice. Front desk staff were very helpful and always able to recommend places. Situated in gaslamp quarter, so no shortage of places to eat at night. We ate once at the Royal Thai restaurant just round the corner from the hotel and found the found to be excellent. We'd also recommend the Old town trolley tours (they have a stop close to the hotel) as we got so much more out of the trip by getting a knowledgable (and entertaining) commentary as we went around the city.

Reviews.Title: “great roof top and a boutique feel to it”
Reviews.Author: tdan49
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, plus points rooftop bar, furnishings, location, happy hour. A couple of niggly minus points ie $35 dollars per night valet parking and breakfast was alittle disorganised some days. would I stay again, you bet

Reviews.Title: “A great stay and amazing customer service. Wendy the Desk Manager and her team were outstanding and...”
Reviews.Author: Purplewarrior
Reviews.Content: I couldn't disagree more about the comment below stating they thought the staff needed training. That Guest must have had a bad day. I stayed with a group and frankly didn't know what to expect. I figured since we were with a group we would get lost in the shuffle. Coulnd't be further from the truth. We arrived and were greated with a lovely young service agent with braces. We were early but she informed us we could leave our luggage pre check in and she would call us if the room was ready. She also asked if we wanted recommendations for lunch which we declined but probably should have listened because we went to an overpriced itialian place that was not very good on 5th. While we were waiting and debating on what to do next we were called by the front desk Manager Wendy who let us know not only our room was ready but we were even upgraded to a king spa. We rushed though the medicore at best lunch and headed back. The bell staff were prompt with door service There were a pair of new faces at the front desk an Asian girl and a shorter Blonde girl who both were so nice instantly greeted me with a warm smile.(sorrry I can't remember their names thin one of their names was Page or Kim. something along those lines) They handed me my Keys and I arrived at the very modern decor of the larger then expected room. I noticed their were down pillows on the bed which I am desperately allergic to and before I could call down my phone rang. It was one of the girls at the front desk greeting me with a sincere greeting and asked if I needed anything. I let them know about the pillows, they were very apologetic and assured me knew pillows would be up soon. It took about 15 minutes. We enjoyed our stay in San Diego and the other thing worth mentioning was there was a crazy party going on upstairs and I called downstairs about 1 am on a friday. The gentleman at the front desk was very professional calm and apologetic. He let me know that someone would be up as soon as possible. I was waiting outside to point security to the right room and 2 gentleman, a stockier guy and a blonde guy who appeared to be security. They also greeted me with a smile and apolgized for the inconveninace and heard how loud it was. They let me know it might be a good idea to get back in my room so the guests wouldnt know it was me. They asked if I was interested in breakfast for the inconveniance whihc I declined and said it wasn't necessary. It was a great offer. The room did get loud once more but I heard the gentleman come back and talk to them and that was the end of it.I didn't get a chance to go to J-six or the pool bar but will on my next visit. I had a great time and wanted to thank the front desk and security staff for a beautiful warm and welcoming stay. Keep up the good work and don't listen to the naysayers. You have a great product. By they way I have been in Resort Management for years so I know a thing or 2 about great service and don't you know I wish I could recruite some of the key players at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice amenities. Train personnel in good customer service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LaGitana30
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this hotel and was happy to switch to the Omni for the rest of my trip. While the amenities are really nice (swimming pool with a terrace bar located closeby, wine tasting every night, well-appointed room, etc.) the level of service is seriously lacking. This hotel is part of the Kimpton chain, and I thought that I would get a level of service similar to the one received during a previous stay at the Sir Francis Drake in San Franciso. I was so wrong!!! The front desk personnel is clueless about making guests feeling welcomed and pampered. I was forced to ask the front desk employee if somebody can help me with my luggage on arrival. Her answer? "I am going to check IF somebody is available" IF????? This should not happened in a 4 star hotel! A guest commented the following during the wine tasting hour: "They serve free wine to make us forgetting about their shortcomings in the service department". I could not agree more! On the plus side, hotel very well located in the Gaslamp district, close to all bars/restaurants/shops. Very vibrant bar terrace scene. I would recommend sending the personnel to a serious customer service training, and this hotel might become a real 4 star within one year. Right now, this is not the case. It feels more like a "help yourself" 3 star with a couple of perks added. Finally, I should mention that after receiving a $10 coupon for mini-bar merchandise and getting the discount on my bill, I realized there was a mini bar charge made on my credit card after I left the Solamar. This charge was ultimately refunded after I called the hotel; another annoyance!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a prime location”
Reviews.Author: Tarvold
Reviews.Content: We got a decent deal from a 3. party provider for our weekend in San Diego. Perhaps as a result, perhaps by chance, we got rooms directly overlooking the rooftop pool/bar. Even though it was weekend and the bar was popular, we had absolutely no problem with noise or otherwise because of this. The location was fantastic and the area is scattered with excellent restaurants & bars. The room was nice and spacious, service in the hotel was excellent and the help & recommendations we got from the reception were very good. The breakfast was basic and we had to wait approx. 15 minutes for a table. Valet parking was very expensive but upon asking we were informed of the options and still considered this to be the best deal we would get. If you are willing to make the effort it's likely you can save some money. We were not.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment for a supposedly premium hotel."”
Reviews.Author: Aksarbenga
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice with a good decor, but misses the mark in many small ways, and a few big ways: 1. Valet parking is $35/night. Way too high. 2. The rooms lack higher-end amenities like coffeemakers, soap, mouthwash, etc. 3. Paper products are incredibly coarse ... certainly not soft on noses or bottoms. 4. TV is missing many major TV channels -- like AMC, HBO, HGTV, etc. Stayed there on the night of the premium of season 4 of Mad Men and couldn't even watch it. Couldn't even watch the Padres' games on TV at night. 5. A/C was either too hot or too cold. 6. Street noise was incredibly loud, even on the 9th floor. 7. Safe didn't work but was corrected. 8. Missing a lot of basic communications -- a guest handbook, a TV channel listings, etc. 9. Bed was quite hard and difficult to sleep in ... 10. Printers in business center didn't work. I wouldn't pay full price. It is an okay hotel, but nothing to write home about and if you can get it at a good price, that's fine. 7.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: stripey2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and i spent 4 nights at this hotel over a weekend recently. We both absolutely loved this place, Kimpton have really hit the nail on the head here and created my perfect hotel. All of the public areas were as gorgeous as the room itself. The whole place was bang up to date, modern and contemporary with fantastic sexy, moody decor throughout. The rooftop poolside was just fabulous. I love the review posted by the guy below, regarding the poolside being like the set of a beer commercial, he’s not wrong! I think that was a very creative way to describe it and so correct too! A small heated pool, surrounded by contemporary loungers with gaudy towels, palm trees and seating areas dotted all over, and a great looking bar with lots of people enjoying a beer in the sunshine with a few tunes. Saturday night was our favourite night, the pool bar and terrace (Lounge-six) gets packed with partygoers and was one of our best nights partying. Only one thing spoilt it and that’s drinks being served in plastic glasses, yack. Our room overlooked the poolside terrace but with the window closed you could not hear any noise at all. To the right of the ample worktop/dresser, i found the minibar to be probably the best stocked minibar i’ve ever seen. It had everything, a massive selection of different drinks and loads of snacks too. I was very happy to see that it was actually quite well priced and not a rip off like some hotels. The beds were really comfy with quality linen and the bathrooms were superb with a super powerful shower. We stayed on a bed and breakfast board basis and the breakfast was served downstairs in the hotel restaurant called J-six. Each morning a continental breakfast was served which my wife thoroughly enjoyed, but i wanted something a little more substantial. There was an option to upgrade (for a small fee) to the All American Breakfast, and i can honestly say that it was the very best breakfast i have ever experienced in any hotel i have ever visited (and that’s a lot!). So be sure to go get one! The location of the hotel was probably the icing on the cake, located just one small block over from the main street of the historic Gaslamp district where all the nightlife is situated. If you stay in San Diego then you absolutely cannot miss the experience of a Saturday night on the main street in the Gaslamp. The electric atmosphere is absolutely buzzing, almost magical, and there is a dizzying array of bars and restaurants to choose from. I would definitely return to the Solamar Hotel and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a modern, funky, and well located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Party, style, comfort... noise”
Reviews.Author: zoler
Reviews.Content: The room was luxurious all around. The valet, although pricey, is understandable given the location. The complimentary iced coffee (morning) and wine/sangria/tea/lemonade (afternoon) were all nice perks. When I entered the outdoor pool area on the fourth floor, I thought I had walked onto the set of a beer commercial: a bar and pool filled with half-naked men and women enjoying their stay. That said, it was a nice place to relax and spend an afternoon. My only complaint would be the noise: dogs barking in the wee hours of the night; then a pot-smoking, hip-hop-blasting jerk nextdoor. It took an hour of calling the front desk before this guy finally settled down around 1:30am. Meanwhile, our room (with a shared suite door) reeked of marijuana smoke. A bit of bad luck, I suppose. Had anyone asked how our stay was, I would have been happy to mention this.

Reviews.Title: “Another Win From Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: GreenMonster19
Reviews.Content: This was our first time visiting San Diego as a family. The Solamar was recommended by friends and we understand why. The hotel is comfortable and well-appointed (except for the fitness center, which is very small) and the location is ideal -- walking distance to great food, shopping, and Petco Park, and an easy drive to Coronado and the freeways to coastal towns and beaches. The staff was friendly and made an adjustment to our room when there was a mix-up with the accommodations we had booked. We got very helpful suggestions for places to eat and see and we enjoyed hanging out by the pool -- even if it was a bit crowded. We would not hesitate to stay at the Solamar again when we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: possum13
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this Hotel and to be honest I didn't want to leave. Bedroom was beautiful and very comfortable beds . It was close to shops and restauraunts, staff were very friendy and helpful. Free wine between 5 and 6pm and free complimentary fresh fruit, pastry and coffee for breakfast. I would definitely recommend this Hotel to others. If ever I go back to San diego this would definitely be my choice. Maybe only downside was valet parking $30 per night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moonjelly
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful, the hotel room was beautiful, the pool was fun, the location perfect, and, as always, we looked forward to the wine hour (especially the sangria) every day.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: spectra21
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with Hotel Solamar for providing a comfortable weekend getaway. Staff at the check-in desk was very courteous and professional.The hotel has a boutique feel, and seems to attract mostly couples. We saw a few small families with a baby, but definitely this is not a hotel with a lot of kids running around. The hotel welcomes dogs, but this did not bother us, and it seemed like the pets were mostly small "toy dogs" and pooches. Free WiFi for Kimpton members.The rooftop bar and lounge is also pretty cool, and provides a fun place for young adults to chill and hang out. The location was excellent, and it was very easy to walk to many restaurants and bars downtown. The main drawback is the expensive overnight valet parking. Definitely consider parking across the street in the open lot, which is $15 overnight, or 2 blocks away in the indoor garage by Marriott, which is $17 overnight. The wine reception at 5pm nightly was nice, though they repeated the wines when we were there on consecutive nights -- we've had better wine selection in other Kimptons. If we visit San Diego in the future, we would try to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance with a smile”
Reviews.Author: HRtraveler62
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel for a solo traveler. My room was small but comfortable and well appointed. The view was of the pool 4 floors below and I worried about the noise, but the sound proofing was some of the best I've seen and I was able to sleep without ear-plugs. Morning coffee is in the lobby, which is apparently a San Diego thing, and proved not to be a problem. Afternoons offered lemonade and later wine - a nice touch. A green hotel that seemed to live by the green tenants. Everyone was friendly. As I was waiting for the shuttle to the airport, I overheard the front desk deal with a very difficult customer, and they did so with patience (more than I'd have) and concern. I did not use the pool area or restaurant. The broken yolk is a few doors away, and the gaslight area abounds with restaurants of every type and price. A lovely location.

Reviews.Title: “Great for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Jeangraf
Reviews.Content: We travelled to San Diego for 4 Nights and we stayed the whole time at Solamar. We had a great time. We got a very nice room. What you have to know: if you get a room facing the lounge and pool area, it can get quite noise until 1.00am. But for us it was not a problem - could be for some others. We enjoyed the bar/lounge area every night before going to a baseball match, nearby gaslamp district for dinner, bars and shopping or whatever you wanna do. It's a modern style hotel. The only place we didn't like was the breakfast "hall". For us it didn't have a nice atmosphere so we went elswhere for breakfast. we enjoyed valet parking - which is nice - but pricey. But we didn't want to look for parkings all the time so we decided to do that. San Diego was great, Solamar was great - allthough the weather was quite cold for the season. I can highly recommend Solamar!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jshelton22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights following the San Diego Marathon. The rooms were spacious. I like how we could open our windows and watch people at the roof top pool. They also have a manager's reception in the evening with free wine or sangarias and some passed food. The pool has a great happy hour and the atmosphere was very hip with the fire pits and sofas. The hotel is in the gaslamp district and a short walk to Petco park, convention center, Seaport Village, Horton Plaza. A cab ride to the zoo cost about $25. The Mission Restaurant is only about 4 blocks from here. All of the restaurants in the gaslamp have great happy hour with half price appetiziers.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed staying in this upbeat Gas Lamp quarter hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SummerTripper16
Reviews.Content: Moderately funky atmosphere but not over the top, really courteous bell staff and front desk staff, very comfortable luxury bed, small but nicely appointed room, great San Diego location next to Petco Stadium, 2 blocks from convention center and waterfront, 1 block from Gas Lamp district. 4th floor rooftop bar is a hidden gem. Bathroom sink is funky design and somewhat non-functional - oh, well. JSix restaurant is average -- appetizers better than the entrees. My third visit to San Diego - I'd go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff - great value”
Reviews.Author: bsjs25
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd Kimpton hotel we have stayed in this month and they have not disappointed. The service, the room and the location were excellent. A great base for exploring San Diego. The rooms were well maintained and clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, however!”
Reviews.Author: Bindisue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights following a wonderful trip driving from San Franscisco along the Pacific Highway with our final destination being the Hotel Solamar in San Diego. The rooms were very stylish and comfortable. Our room was on the fifth floor over looking the pool area and although the bed was heavenly, my sleep was disturbed every night until around 2.00am because of the loud music and partying around the pool area. The bowl of fruit and pastries at breakfast were very welcoming. The wine tasting between 5-6 was fantastic with some wonderful tasting wines. I would strongly recommend this hotel although would definitely ask for a room away from the pool area if I stayed again. When we mentioned the problem with the noise at checkout the receptionist changed the subject immediately without comment which did annoy me a little.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: BEXY54
Reviews.Content: My wife visited the Solamar from 26/5/10 to 2/6/2010 on a trip to California from the UK..This is the best hotel we have ever stayed inthe setting,the pool,the staff go out of their wat to help you at all times the breakfasts are superb try the fruit bowl in a morning so refreshing to get your day started.We had a great view of the pool and also Petco Park from our room which was so big not to mention the bed whic was wonderful.I would just like to say thanks to connected with the Solamar/Kimpton thanks for making it a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Hotel: Hip, Friendly and Unpretentious and GREAT location!!”
Reviews.Author: MABlissful
Reviews.Content: Booked this great hotel on priceline and got a great deal and was NOT treated as a second class citizen because of this! Genuinely friendly staff, fantastic downtown location, 15 min. from airport, next to stadium and Gaslamp district..brilliant location. Afternoon wine tastings was fabulous and morning coffee/tea beautifully laid out in the chic lobby in the mornings. My room was spacious, well decorated and very clean. Truly loved everything about this hotel! The staff has really set a standard and this San Diego team should be the lead trainers of all the Kimpton hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great part of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jjbetting
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a great part of San Diego. I stayed at this hotel during the Rock & Roll marithon and found it delightful. The hotel staff went out of their way to answer questions that I had and even went so far as to draw me a map so I wouldn't get lost when out walking one evening. The area around this hotel is nice and offers great food and beverage options for late night entertainment. My guest room was spacious and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Say Enough Good About It”
Reviews.Author: jennherlihy
Reviews.Content: We loved, loved this hotel! My husband and I stayed during the Rock N' Roll San Diego Marathon. The hotel was full of runners but you certainly couldn't tell. The hotel offerred 4:30 am coffee and oatmeal for runners which was above and beyond the call of duty, as they weren't partnered with Rock N' Roll. The rooms were lovely --- stylish, clean, comfortable, modern, etc. The pool was beautiful. The hotel offers lemonade, ice tea, etc. in the afternoon and a hosted wine hour between 5-6 pm. We didn't get to attend but it looked like a lot of fun! We also didn't get to try out the restaurant but it too looked great. The hotel staff were courteous and helpful, allowing us to store our baggage on both ends of the trip and allowing an early check-in. Definitely sign up for Kimpton In Touch --- they treat you very well with a mini-bar raid card, free internet and other incentives.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: mac1419
Reviews.Content: Solid hotel for the money. Rooms were nice and quiet. Bed was typical Kimpton, that is, very comfortable. The gym needs a SERIOUS upgrade. Had breakfast at the restaurant and it was fantastic. Great toast and jelly.

Reviews.Title: “First choice for any return visit to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: mwux
Reviews.Content: I booked our room through Expedia and was able to get it for $80+ dollars per night. It was a great price for such a trendy and romantic place to stay! The room and bathroom were not only aesthetically pleasing in design, but had good quality beds, linens, curtains, etc. and were extremely clean. I loved the bathroom with its large mirror, wide bath (the shower was heavenly with strong hot water), and colorful blue tiles on a whitewashed wall that simply says "Mediterranean" to me. The hotel has a great restaurant we did not get to try out, but it was within short distance of great restaurants and bars, the trolley station, and a CVS on the next block. The heated pool and lounge on the rooftop was terrific as well!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It<3”
Reviews.Author: Ord1983
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. We checked in early and they did not have a problem with that. The room was very nice. The pool area is beautiful. The location is excellent. I didn't want to leave! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tracers73
Reviews.Content: As always Kimpton Hotels do not disappoint. I have stayed with Kimptons in Miami and Chicago, and now San Diego. Every time I find one, I am never disappointed. Room was beautiful in decor. Bed was not as soft as I like, but that is just a personal preference. The room was plenty big, with a huge closet. Shower had awesome water flow! Fitness center was small but enough to serve my needs. Coffee/tea service in the morning in The Living Room was perfect. Easy to grab before I headed out each morning on my next adventure. Parking is outrageous - park down the street at 6th & K for $10. It's just a block to walk and it is a safe neighborhood, so no worries walking back from your car at night. Only negative comments I would have about the hotel was the fact that there was a conference going on while I was there where they had trade show tables set up in a common area of the hotel, mainly blocking the entry to the restaurant, as well as the ATM machine. Otherwise, the stay was great, and it is a lovely hotel. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly, enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: janestclaire95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Solamar for a family gathering in March. Rooms were well appointed, clean, and spacious. We used the internet service extensively with no problems. We traveled with a dog, and they were accommodating to our pet. Overall, a perfectly enjoyable stay. The restaurant and hotel are both on the expensive side, but the service is wonderful. Unfortunately, each night our sleep was interrupted by an unruly, drunken crowd (associated with a wedding at the hotel) making a great deal of noise between 2-4 AM. This happened to several members of our group, on different floors of the hotel during both nights of our weekend stay. These rude drunken guests interrupted our sleep to the point where we eventually opened the door of our room and asked them to quiet down. This was a disappointing and incongruous event in our stay. Ideally the management would locate all disruptive and unruly drunkards on a single floor, so they could wake each other. We enjoyed meals at the attached restaurant, and the food was great, if expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A "green hotel" that wanted your "green"!”
Reviews.Author: traukind
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be non-functional in a few ways. I was shocked to find there was a $35 charge for "valet parking" for each day of the conference, a fee not stated in the terms of agreement. This increased the price of our stay to over $200 per day. This cost was not what our budget was planned for, since we had to stay the whole week for our class. Their statement that parking fees at $35/day are in line with fees throughout San Diego is not true; this hotel is not in New York city. The hotel itinerary mentioned a complimentary expanded continental breakfast to our hosts conducting our class, but I never did see it. The hotel attendants did not mention this to me when I checked in. I assumed that the hotel, particularly with its robust guest charges, had a continental breakfast, but during my first morning I had to order a breakfast at the hotel restaurant for an additional charge, and the time of waited service made me late for the class, so I forwent additional breakfasts for the remaining time I was at the hotel. Also, the wireless network was difficult to implement, both in the rooms and in the conference rooms. The hotel had a few types of wireless service, one of which was "free internet," requiring a membership to the hotel, which by this time I did not want to join, as I did not want any future e-mails from the hotel. While I was eventually given an e-mail password to logon to the free wireless network, my laptop would frequently try to lock on the wireless service requiring a fee, since the free wireless was set to a weaker signal. I found the hotel requiring any wireless charges onerous, considering that most other hotels provide free service, and hotel charges at this place were at a premium. Finally, I found the hotel rooms lacking amenities, such as a simple coffee maker, and an empty refrigerator. The refrigerator and shelves were all stuffed with expensive drinks the guest was supposed to buy. Since there was no room to put my books up, I had to push all the drinks aside. I felt the hotel was more interested in alcohol sales than providing a functioning room for the guest. To add insult to injury, I was erroneously charged $11 at checkout for a water bottle they claimed I taken, but I had to use it to block the non-functioning safe's door from continuously swinging open. The hotel advertises that it is “green friendly.” Perhaps they were referring to the green one had to produce to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great service”
Reviews.Author: eawnyc
Reviews.Content: The Kimpton Hotel have figured out to provide value and service in great locations with accessibility to sights and restaurants. Kimpton is my 'go to' brand when traveling throughout the US. Hotel Solamar is conveniently located near the Padres new stadium and the GasLamp district. Stylishly designed room with extremely comfortable bed. The open wine tasting at 5pm is a welcome addition at the end of the day or before the evening out. J-Six serves local, sustainable food at affordable prices. Hotel recommendations for local coffee shops and dinner restaurants were 'spot on'. It's clear that Hotel Solamar cares about their customers. My only confusion was lack of access to a roof top pool during the afternoon (a group of college students had 'taken over'). The hotel did not recommend we relax there. Should not the pool be accessible to all guests?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: zippyland
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Excellent location in the Gaslamp Quarter. Husband had a conference at the Convention Center, and was very close -- perhaps a five-minute walk. Close to all the restaurants and nightlife in the Gaslamp. Very comfortable bed, nice furnishings, free wi-fi, great bath products. Bathroom was quite small, but well-appointed with attractive tile and modern sleek look. Room overlooked pool, but was totally quiet and restful (despite pool having an active bar). Hotel had nice extras -- lively wine hour, free NY Times every day, beautiful rooftop bar. Fitness center is quite small. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like!”
Reviews.Author: filosab
Reviews.Content: My folks spent this past weekend at Hotel Solamar and I spent some time there as well. The location is ideal, steps from Petco, The Broken Yolk Cafe, Tivoli Bar and Stingaree. The room has a lot of charm and character, not "luxurious" like the Omni, but character and personality. The bathroom is small, but perfectly decorated. Pet friendly, lots of well behaved dogs and lots of happy clients with their dogs. Beautiful lobby area, very comfy, wonderful lighting, the wine hour is wonderful, the setting in the lobby is wonderful as well. Coffee in the morning in the lobby was a great treat. This was a score on priceline and we hope to stay again in the near future. Lots of nice touches that set it apart from the bigger national chains.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: JoJoDro
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with some girlfriend's for a bachlorette party. This hotel was really cute - the rooms were decent, although the sink in the bathrooms are tilted & akward & the lighting sucks in the bathroom. The rooftop pool & bar make up for that though! Perfect spot to come have a cocktail before getting ready to go out on the town. In the Gas Lamp district, a walking distance to great restaurants, bars & clubs. We all enjoyed our stay here. Breakfast in the morning was a bit on the pricy side...go somewhere else for sure. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice! Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: jerseytraveler82
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights at the Solamar. Really, couldnt recommend it more! Perfect location in the middle of all the restaurants, bars, shopping in the Gaslamp District. Also within walking distance to the trolley/transit system (which was also very easy to navigate!) The staff was friendly and welcoming. The wine hour from 5-6 every night was very nice, everyone sits around the "living room" area off the lobby with couches, chairs, a fire place. Very nice feel - and a way to get to know others staying in the hotel if you choose to. The breakfasts were excellent, but like others say - the Broken Yolk Cafe is one block down, and its AMAZING! Definitely go there! And don't worry about the parking situation at all. The $35 per night fee at the hotel is insane! We parked 2 blocks down, and for 2 full days and nights it only cost us $16. MUCH more worth it. The "blocks" in this city are small and the distance is minimal and worth the lower cost. The beds were super comfortable, the rooms very relaxing. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Diego wanting a more 'boutique' feel without being too stuffy!

Reviews.Title: “I love Hotel Solamar”
Reviews.Author: AltraDenver_Colorado
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Hotel Solamar over 20 times now and each and every time I do, it is an absolute pleasure. Business travel can become a real grind but knowing that you get to spend the night at Hotel Solamar makes it something I absolutely look forward to. Congrats to the management and staff at Solamar for becoming my favorite place to stay in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: indikanegril
Reviews.Content: great location in the Gaslamp- fresh organic cuisine in the restaurant, free wine reception from 5-6, nicely appointed decent sized rooms done with a smaller budget contemporary flair. Dog friendly, free internet if you sign up for their ff club. water pressure, pillows, mattress, noise level, all what you would expect from 4 star. hated having to go and get my coffee in the lobby at 6am- they save on coffee makers, no little bottles of shampoo etc. (dispensers in the shower). Gym is on the lame side- tiny and just a few older treadmills. nice rooftop pool/ party area-great for a party( have had two there Would stay again( but find a real gym to work out at).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Kimpton - except for Fitness Center”
Reviews.Author: MplsBoys
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a great Kimpton property with all the typical amenities. The only caution I would have is for business travelers who want a fitness center - the "fitness center" here is one elliptical and two aging treadmills packed into an oversized closet - something you might expect at a cheap express hotel. Not a problem if you are an outside runner - the hotel is very close to the waterfront - but absolutely a disappointment if you want a quick workout inside before starting your day. Certainly the most lackluster exercise options I've seen on a Kimpton property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel...will look for other Kimpton hotels in the future!”
Reviews.Author: dls1834
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. Very personal feeling and great location! The gaslamp district is right outside your door. Staff was very friendly. I hear the hotel is pet friendly but I swear you wouldn't know it unless someone told you. No site or smell of any animals. The pool and poolside bar are very relaxing. The beds are so cozy and the room decor is really fun. Can't say enough for this hotel and will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SherlockEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and could not fault the hotel comfort or the service. We unfortunately did not get to make use of the outdoor pool or early morning yoga out beside it due to the weather! The location in the heart of the Gaslamp district was perfect. The area has a great buzz about it at night but the hotel's location is quiet enough that you can get a good nights's sleep in a large comfy bed. The giraffe and zebra print bathrooms and are fun too ! The front of out, restaurant and bar staff were all really friendly and helpful (even running out to buy us all umbrella's to borrow during unusually wet weather for So Cal). Would definitely go back to San Diego and stay at the Solomar again. The free early wine tasting is a nice touch too.

Reviews.Title: “Good property location right in downtown”
Reviews.Author: mbusa
Reviews.Content: Nice Kimpton property in SAN DIEGO, Was there for 3 nights with small children. We had a nice corner room with no view but a comfortable bed , two TV's and one large bathroom plus a fridge which was good to keep snacks for our kids. The room was a Jr suite and the kids slept on a foldout bed which would only be OK for children not adults. Check-in was easy however the drive in area of the hotel is cramped and at busy times you might have to wait which could be a pain and overnight is $35.00 , however there are numerous cheaper parking options in the same area just not valet. The Valet staff was great moving cars and freeing up space for cars to enter. Had room service the first night which was good however there was a mandatory 22% gratuity on over priced food and a $3.00 delivery fee, which is excessive. The food was good and delivered in a timely manner for a friday night. The restaurant was nice we had breakfast there two mornings , standard breakfast menus with pleasant staff. The hotel was busy seems like one of the spots to stay , we saw a lot of guests with their pets and on SATURDAY the pool area is a outdoor club/lounge which gets noisy if your facing the pool/lounge area at night. The pool is small warm and nice with towels and sporadic drink service maybe around 15 lounges for guest use and a few covered cabanas. Close by is a CVS, Ralphs Grocery and 20-30 places to eat and drink. If your just coming to dtwn area one does not need a car for everything is close including the Zoo and there always was a taxi ready in front of the hotel. I would head back here again for the deal I got and for the location was great for dtwn San Diego. The evening wine was a Kimpton norm and appreciated and the free wifi worked sometimes , I got better service using the wifi from a hotel across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice decor--comfy bed. Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: azroxie
Reviews.Content: Comfy bed, fluffy pillows, clean room, free coffee, and friendly service... Got a really cheap rate from Priceline and was placed into a standard King bed room. I really liked the bathroom's soft lighting, fantastic water pressure, and lots of hot water! Nice decor in the lobby and lovely decor in the room. The only thing I didn't like was the $32 parking (valet only). No worries, we parked 2 blocks down on 6th Ave in a parking garage for $14 overnight. If you sign up for their "In Touch" program, you can get FREE wi-fi, didn't have my laptop with me, so they gave me a $10 coupon for 2 complimentary items in the room's mini-bar for beverage or snacks. The restaurant was expensive, so we ate at the Broken Yolk Cafe around the corner (very slow service!). If you have time, try the Mission for breakfast, which is a few blocks over on J street. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My perfect room for business travel”
Reviews.Author: hankpop
Reviews.Content: I was at the Solamar for 3 days on business and it was great. I was in a King Spa room, which had my ideal layout for a hotel room when I'm traveling for work. There was an enormous spa tub that I could sit up in. From the tub, could relax and watch the big, flat screen TV. When I'm by myself on the road, nothing could make me happier. The hotel was cozy and attractive and the staff were very friendly and helpful. There are lots of good restaurants in the neighborhood and it was easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and staff”
Reviews.Author: wonderful58
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel and the friendly staff make this a great choice for travellers to San Diego. It is close enough to walk everywhere. You can take the trolley [5 min. from hotel] to Tijuana for 5.00 r/t and walk across the border to shop. The gaslamp district and Horton Plaza are only minutes walk away and Petco Park for a ballgame is right there. I am a Kimpton in touch member as there hotels are always clean and hospitable. They make you feel like you are someone special. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Small Hotel - Bargains Available”
Reviews.Author: thomasbaker
Reviews.Content: The decor of the public areas and rooms of this hotel is quite beautiful, and everything seems extremely well cared for. The room was very comfortable (some noisy neighbors next door in the middle of the night were dealt with promptly by the staff). The restaurant served a superb lunch. The printer was broken in the business center, but the front desk staff were happy to make the copies I needed. And somehow, I booked in advance and got my room for $89. At that price, it's a truly exceptional bargain, and at twice that still a pretty good deal given the downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: maw0512
Reviews.Content: Stay at Hotel Solamar last weekend, stay here for only one night for a quick getaway; it's a beautiful hotel, we can feel welcome in the air from the moment we walk-in to the lobby; check-in was fast. We were stay in room 627 that facing the pool/lounge. Room were very clean and nice. Heard little dog barking and you can tell this hotel are pet friendly. Didn't bother us because they are not really bark all the time. We just rest for a half hour than we head to the welcome lounge area that next to the lobby for the manager reception. They do not served you a cheap wines just because it's free for the guests; the manager were very friendly and greeting everyone with the wine. Again, you feel welcome. Too bad that it's raining, otherwise, we will be hanging out at the pool/lounge area, because it's so trendy. We also missed the yoga class next morning at pool area since we were out for our morning walking. The location is great, we catch little storm break and went to across street Puma store shopping for a little bit. We decided look around for a great dinner spot. We end up back to the hotel restaurant since the menu looks great and yes, we did check on Gayot.com for the food rating. It was great choice, we had a delicious 3 courses meal for $35 each; Thanks to the San Diego dining week menu. We had a breakfast at the same restaurant the next day; it was okay, kinda simple breakfast but you pay more. Across street next to Palm Restaurant do have a great and cheaper breakfast place. We walked by after we finish our breakfast. We will go back again; that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel made better by its staff”
Reviews.Author: MaineIzzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room #931 for three nights. King bed overlooking pool/bar area. Room was ample size for two people - oddly there is no dresser, just a closet. Bed was comfy. Flat screen TV, but no HD and no HBO. Bathroom was pretty good, tho no natural light. Plenty of natural light from street side. Bar/pool is hoppin' on weekend nights. I worried about the noise, but used the room's fan and my own white noise machine and had no troubles - light sleepers will want to be aware of bar noise. The staff is helpful, with exception of valets. When I arrived in a taxi, valet removed my bags from taxi but made no offer to bring inside. Weird and kinda rude. Neighborhood is full of bars/restaurants/drunk hipsters, not much shopping. It's a pretty easy walk to the water, trolley & Nordstrom. The Broken Yolk is one block away and a nice place for breakfast. Front desk staff great, even let me check in early, which is so nice after a cross-country flight. No in-room coffee (boo) but free coffee in the lobby each morning. Overall a good hotel made better by its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Room was too small; No in-room coffee; Parking was too expensive.”
Reviews.Author: D.C.GeeCee
Reviews.Content: The hotel's parking policy is exploitive : $35 (plus tips) per day for valet parking; no self-parking allowed. Similarly, bottled water in the room was $5.50. There was no coffee-maker in the room, so each morning you have to dress and go down to the lobby to get your cup of coffee. The room was so small there was no space for a dresser. Indeed, there were no drawers at all. I had to live out of my suitcase for 5 days. The location was convenient, but not worth all the annoyance. Never, never again would I stay at the Solamor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ricky347
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really nice; they have a wine happy hour from 5-6 and a heated swimming pool with a nice bar. It's walkable to the beach (1 mile or so) and 5 minutes from bars on 5th Avenue. Parking is expensive at the hotel, but we found every night on the street, so I recommend you try that first. Really great place, I was nervous when Priceline sent me here, but overall we had a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Luis043
Reviews.Content: As the previous commenter, we got a good deal at the Solamar and stayed there for two days. Hotel belongs to Kimpton franchise which we generally like. The Solamar is modern and well-decorated, rooms are comfortable, location is great (middle of Gaslamp district). At the same time, small details prevent this from being a hotel that you could pay full price for: fragments of some bathroom tiles were missing, bath tub faucet couldn't be closed all the way. We also had a problem with a laundry order upon check-out, which was handled unprofessionally by the hotel reception and left a somewhat bitter taste. Certainly worth it for the $100-150 we paid, certainly not worth it for the full price. We stayed at the Indigo hotel (two blocks away) before switching to the Solamar (which was full for New Year's Eve) and had a better experience in a similar type of hotel

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but not truly luxurious”
Reviews.Author: molly_2010
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Hotel Solamar was pretty good. We got a REALLY good deal on a travel site, but I wouldn't have paid full price for it. I would recommend it to someone only if they received a similar deal because it definitely wasn't worth what they charge per night without the discount. I travel several times a year, and have stayed in many luxury hotels, and while Hotel Solamar was nice, it was not at all what I expect from a luxury hotel. The location was absolutely perfect though, but next time I travel to San Diego, I probably wouldn't stay there again unless I got another REALLY good deal. If you want people to be impressed that you are staying at a crazy expensive hotel, stay here. If you want real luxury, go somewhere else. Pros: Beautiful and modern decor; friendly and helpful staff; great location, right in Gaslamp; very pet-friendly; free coffee in morning and wine in evening; beautiful pool on terrace Cons: temperature control was impossible, room was either burning up or freezing; water pressure was out of control, nearly ripped my skin off; bed extremely noisy, I couldn't roll over at night without waking my husband up for all the squeaking; no coffee pot in room; while staff was friendly and helpful, they weren't always correct in their advice (one sent us to a trolley stop way out of the way, another told us the wrong bus to take, and another sent us to a restaurant that she said was exactly what we described when it actually was the opposite of what we described); our room overlooked the pool, which was beautiful, but crazy loud on the weekends

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay close to convention center and gaslamp district”
Reviews.Author: rajah1993
Reviews.Content: Received an excellent rate from my conference and was very happy with my choice. I could walk to the convention center in less than 5 minutes and then was right next to the gas lamp district for meals and entertainment. Hotel room was large, clean, and modern. My room happened to be right by a bar outside that was very noisy on Friday and Saturday. I don't mind the noise so I didnt ask to move though I'm sure they would have moved me if I requested. You may want to inquire at check-in if this bothers you or if you are traveling with children. The hotel also offered complimentary wine every evening and free internet if you became a member of their "In-Touch" program which is free...so definitely do that. At check in I received a $10 voucher to be used in the room for food. Hotel has a bar/club that I went to one night. It was very nice, but it seemed more of a 20s/30s place so I felt a little out of place. I didn't see many kids at the hotel and it didn't necessarily seem to be kid-centered, but maybe if I had my family with me I would have noticed more. Staff that I interacted with were all friendly and helpful. If I comeback to this area of San Diego (Gaslamp or convention center) I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Overall”
Reviews.Author: jayster
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed one night at Hotel Solamar with our 44 pound dog. Arrival was smooth. Front desk was busy, but everyone was handled very efficiently while staff maintained high levels of attention and courtesy. An email about my partner's birthday and dog needing a bed and bowl were not received, but front desk agent and bellman both made sure the dog supplies were sent up immediately. I had put in a preference for foam pillows, but room had feather. However, website does make it clear that preferences are not guaranteed. The room was on the smaller side of average, but ample for our stay. Decor was modern and funky. Bathroom as well. Instead of sample size shampoos and soaps, hotel puts dispensers in the shower. While you aren't able to take them as mementos, they are high-quality Gilchrist and Soames. The room was clean. Our dog came with and was greeted warmly by both staff and other guests at complimentary wine hour. Pizza and warm nuts were also provided. A previous reviewer complained about all the dogs at the hotel, but note this is a Kimpton which has a very liberal chain-wide pet policy. And there are two parks within walking distance for dogs (PETCO is closed after dark, though). After wine hour, front desk was very helpful with map and directions. Note that valet parking is $35, but with full in-and-out priveleges. We look forward to our next stay here.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: ctandsn
Reviews.Content: went to san diego with my two nieces (5 and 10years old) and my mom--stayed at hotel solamar after a long day at Seaworld. Rooms were modern, clean and very comfortable. Non-smoking enviornment with two very inviting queen beds that were perfect for the four of us. didn't notice much noise (but it was a Monday night...). Had a very restful sleep in preparation of our visit to the san diego zoo the next day (which was less than10minutes drive away). I had named my own price on priceline.com and got a really good deal ($65 but including tax it was $81). The only complaint I have is the VERY expensive parking fee of $35 per night for valet parking. It was really late and cold when we arrived so I didn't feel safe walking to the parking garage two blocks down for cheaper parking (maybe it would have been different if I was a guy).

Reviews.Title: “Modern, stylish base for downtown SD experience”
Reviews.Author: jeanki
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here at Hotel Solamar. It is a stylish, well-appointed hotel, with a personal boutique feel. There is a nice lounge where they provide free coffee/tea service in the morning, and wine receptions in the early evening. There is also a hip small bar and pool area on the 4th floor deck (although not active currently in the winter). The rooms are somewhat small but decorated nicely, with clean, stylish bathrooms and a very comfortable bed with their trademark super-silky Frette linens. My location was quiet initially, but during the summer it might have been noisy since it faced the pool area. Also there were some noisy partiers we could hear thru the wall another night, but they seemed to quiet down after we alerted the front desk. The location can't be beat; slightly off the main drag in the Gaslamp Quarter, at the edge of the East Village. As a result it is less hectic, but still only a block to the main action. A CVS is a block away which is convenient. There is a nice restaurant in the hotel also; my spouse wanted a late-night coffee and despite running a busy dinner service, the hostess went and got a complementary coffee for him! That is service. Parking, as expected for this area, is expensive valet only (around $36/night) but there are also some parking lots/garages nearby. There are large, convention size hotels all over downtown SD, but this one has style and character and feels more personal, without sacrificing any conveniences. The hotel rate we got was very reasonable too, probably because it is the off-season. A great place to stay in downtown SD.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and service in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: UnboundTraveler
Reviews.Content: While visiting family for the Thanksgiving holiday I picked up a great price for this hotel and saw that other TripAdvisor reviewers rated it well so I gave it a try. I was not disappointed! Located in the heart of downtown San Diego, the Solomar was an amazing deal. The people at the front desk were very friendly, gave me $20 in vouchers for the mini bar, and even asked me where in the hotel I would like my room to be. They pull out all the stops for service here. For $99 the room was very luxurious. It included a large flat screen TV, a fully stocked "Honor Bar", and an extremely comfortable bed. The bathroom had glass tiles and a large jacuzzi tub shower. These boutique hotel rooms would normally run several hundred dollars, which made it a great deal. It is also within walking distance of all the restaurants, shops, and Horton Plaza mall. I didn't have to park but the only option at the hotel is an expensive $35 per day valet. There are cheaper parking garages only 2 blocks away. The hotel has wine tastings every evening in the lobby, a lounge by the pool, a restaurant, and is very dog friendly. It looks like the employees even brought their pets in and had them behind the counter. With the great location and price, wonderful service, and comfortable rooms, this hotel is an option anyone visiting San Diego should look at. I've never stayed at a Kimpton hotel before but if they are all like this one I will try and find their brand when traveling.

Reviews.Title: “I love staying here!”
Reviews.Author: xseekerx
Reviews.Content: I go to San Diego aprox every 3 months. Every time I go I stay at the Solamar and I wouldn't have it any other way. The hotel is always clean and beautifully maintained. The rooms are spacious and nice. Staff is always courteous and friendly. The location is great! My Yorkie gets to stay for free and is welcomed every single time. The restaurant lunches are excellent! Top notch really. Thanks Kimpton and Hotel Solamar! Tip: The valet parking there can be pretty expensive. To save money on parking I pull in drop my bags with the bellhop then drive to the public parking lot just 2 blocks away. Its like $35 a day to park at Solamar and $13 a day to park 2 blocks away so if you are staying for a few days, its worth it to walk a couple of blocks and save some money (at least for me anyways). Then when I leave I have the bellhop come get and hold my luggage downstairs and then walk 2 blocks to pick up my car. I proceed to drive 2 blocks and pick up my luggage tipping the bellhop a few bucks and I'm on my way.. I usually stay for 5/6 days when I go though :)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding SanDiego Choice, Kimpton Service in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: TLinATL
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several Kimpton hotels and they are generally several notches above the big name brand hotels in both facility quality and staff service, this Solamar is no exception. My overall experience this trip was outstanding! The room was perfect and service was spot on. My room was very well decorated (a Kimpton Trademark) and very large with a super comfortable double wide lounging chair that I really enjoyed relaxing in (I did get a free upgrade to a spa room with a huge spa tub, didn't use the tub but the room was fantastic). As I was traveling on business having fast internet is very useful and the service here was excellent, it was available in my room as wired or WiFi and it never bogged down like happens in many lower tier hotels. The desk set-up was also good with enough room and comfort to spread out and get my work done quickly. They have a free happy hour in the lounge from 5-7 and offered wine, sparkling wine, and spiced hot cider each night. A nice little bonus. Also available in the mornings in the lobby was above average coffee. Excellent location, easy walk to many many restaurants and retail shops. Lots of the local restaurants have live music to enjoy during or after dinner. Although the hotel does allow dogs if you desire to have them with you, I saw no evidence of it during my stay. Someone complained in another review that the place was filled with people with their dogs but I think they must have visited during a special dog event or something because there were none around this week. In fact I've stayed an several pet friendly Kimpton hotels and have only rarely seen a guest with their pet. The rooms are super clean and I have pet allergies but don't have any troubles staying at these hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Oh ,what a night!!!”
Reviews.Author: Riff M
Reviews.Content: Just had a most EXCELLENT stay at the Solamar!!! We live in San Diego and like to stay in different parts of the city for special nights. This was my birthday and we couldn't have picked a nicer place! We checked in early at about 12:30 and not only was our room ready , but we were upgraded to a Master Suite on the pool level. I knew that the pool bar can get noisy but since it was a weekday I accepted the new room and BOY was I happy!! It was just gorgeous! Living room with flat screen, comfy chaise lounge+couch etc and a giant outdoor terrace. I am sure all the rooms have the wonderful bed with its very high thread count sheets and comforter. Even my husband noticed how soft and comfy everything felt. We also enjoyed the giant whirlpool tub in the bathroom. We called down for some bath salts and they were sent right up. It makes your skin feel extra soft after the bath. I think it is definitely worth it to book a room with that kind of tub. The hotel provided nice bathrobes too. We used the pool for some relaxing laps and found the water to be sooo warm. It was almost like another bath. The pool is surrounded by couches and lounges arranged in cozy nooks/cabanas with a bar and fireplace. In the evening at 5PM the hotel hosts a wine hour in the "living room" just off the lobby. They have a different wine theme each week and this one was Spain. So we tasted some bubbly cava and a nice red Tempranillo which I had never had before . Yum! They also had hot apple cider and cold non alcoholic juice. We really enjoyed our one night stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing short of exceptional!!!”
Reviews.Author: rpb2654
Reviews.Content: Love this Hotel! Downtown close to Petco Park and walking distance to Midway Museum and Gas Lamp District. The rooftop pool and bar embodies and ambiance perfectly suited for Southern California sunshine and combines just the right amount of laid back relaxation during the day and energy in the evening/night to appeal. Rooms tend to be more spacious than the average Kimpton Property and are tastefully done.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pposte
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotel in San Diego is now the Hotel Solamar. We took advantage of the upgraded King Corner suite with jacuzzi tub. This tub was AMAZING. I've stayed in lots of great places all around the world and this tub was fantastic. My girlfriend got a huge kick out of it. Room was clean and spacious. Only drawback...not enough drawers to put clothes in. Parking is expensive, but there is a public parking lot directly across the street that'll save you some money. This is a dog friendly place and you will see plenty of them! Secondly, the J Six Lounge is located on the 4th floor so be prepared to hear music until just after midnight. This fact didn't bother us and we enjoyed every minute of our stay there. Food at the J Six Restaurant is quite good. Location is prime. Gas Lamp a block away with countless shops and restaurants to enjoy. Will definitely frequent this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I proposed, she said yes...I think the sweet room helped!”
Reviews.Author: chip_n_diego
Reviews.Content: Yes, I am from San Diego and was looking for an upscale place to get away and propose to my future bride (she said yes) Service is top notch..from the front desk to the bartender to the waitress...smiles and very knowledgable. Awesome room...we had king bed, great view of the city, nice LCD TV, cool modern bathroom (jacuzzi tub...fits two), and spotless. Food at the hotel is solid...try the sliders at the pool. Dinner and breakfast at J-six is top notch. Location is great...walking distance to everything in the gaslamp, ballpark, and east village. Tips: For parking, it is no charge for street meter parking after 6pm on Saturday, and free on Sunday. Found the best rate on rez2go.com In from out of town, or local looking for a staycation...you can't go wrong at the Solamar

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarDeeS
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice and comfortable. The staff were friendly and ready to help. Would love to go back for a personal visit!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and San Diego”
Reviews.Author: GNTLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and we wish it had been more. We were upgraded to fantastic room with a jacuzzi tub. The hotel is clean, the staff are friendly and very helpful and it's perfectly located for walking to the shopping centre and restaurants and the zoo and airport are a short cab ride away. The pool area was really nice and there were plenty of sun loungers available. The prices are also very reasonable for a hotel. The only negative thing I have to say is their is a lack of storage space in the room. You can also get free internet access if you join their membership scheme. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: mlms1206
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Solamar for two nights. The pool area has a great night scene and the restaurant is fantastic. The rooms are good with comfy beds and free wi-fi for Kimpton In Touch members. You have a great view of Petco Field and can even see into parts of the Park from your room. And you can't beat wine hour every night! The bathrooms were ok. They could stand a little refresh of the tubs and showers. But overall, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Modern, and Fun”
Reviews.Author: mcsyto
Reviews.Content: We decided to celebrate our 6th yr wedding anniversary with a nice hotel downtown and were happy with a Kimpton hotel that we stayed at in San Fran. Hotel Solamar -Bar and pool area: Crowded but nice people-watching spot. Modern furniture. Small pool but good enough to dip your legs in and close enough to meet someone new. -Wine happy hour: Good sangria and nice welcome touch to the hotel -Room decor: Very modern with animal print robes. Got the room with the jacuzzi tub. Made for one but two of us got in. -Restaurant: Didn't try it but read reviews that it was good. -Not the most romantic spot but very close to all the good restaurants and hotspots downtown. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What is all the hype about???”
Reviews.Author: tireless_traveler7
Reviews.Content: The pool, which gets all the hype, is neat. Very lounge like with big screen TV's and nice ambience....but the rest of the hotel needs a serious upgrade in management.
