The hotel is undeniably stylish and appears to cater to a trendier crowd. However, the theme is tasteful and not overpowering. The bed and room were comfortable, although the room was a bit small, and well designed. The animal-themed his and her robes are a nice touch as were the name brand toiletries, which my girlfriend recognized and appreciated. On the downside, parking is expensive and cheaper parking is available a block or two from the hotel. The hotel is in the Gaslamp district, so you can explore and still be near the hotel. Very convenient. Overall, given some of the hotel's less than positive reviews here, I was very pleasantly surprised by the helpfulness of the hotel's staff, room comfort and quality of the hotel. Would definitely return if I needed to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Kimpton Property”
Reviews.Author: TravelerDallasTX
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days on business during Sept. First off, the weather is superb in San Diego during this time of year. I highly recommend going at this time because the touristy attractions are less crowded (Zoo/SeaWorld). The Solamar is in the gaslamp district of SD. The valet parking is only $20 per night which I thought was a steal for this area. They have a complimentary wine reception every evening 5pm-6pm. Very smooth touch. Large pours, nice glasses, and no tip jars anywhere to be found. Check in went smoothly. No problems there. The restaurant was nice and moderately priced. The beds are comfortable and the sheets are so soft. Room size is on the larger size and should be no problem for 2-4 people depending on how many beds you have. Complimentary Wireless Internet connection is slower than other hotels I've stayed in. Beware - the Fitness room is tiny, has 2 treadmills w tvs, 1 elliptical, free weights, and a stationary pull machine. It opens at 7am every morning, so if you want to go before then you have to get the front desk to open it (or hope someone else is in their before you). I'd recommend going to the 24hr fitness nearby on a day pass. If you're into boutique hotels and are looking around this area try the Sofia hotel nearby. Should be less expensive and better in every way. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “OK, bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: bill2524
Reviews.Content: This hotel offerred the smallest room of our 4 hotel trip to California, and it was the most expensive. I can accept that being in the city was a part of that cost, but I had expected more. The first few upper floors of the hotel are a parking lot for the guests, controlled by valets. There is parking on adjacent lots yet to be developed, but I recommend using the valets, they are quick and efficient. The hotel was on a corner, but with the rooms up from street level, they are mostly quiet. If you overlook the pool, be prepared for some evening noise from the bar area. Also some hallway noise from thoughtless guests. Did go to the bar area for a looksee, felt sooo out of place! We were the oldest people there! Decor in the common areas was mostly dark, brown shades, caramels, and the room was a also bit odd, plenty of dark brown, but with a bizarre mirror with an unpleasant oversized frame, out of scale. Cleaning was reasonable. The bed was fine, and I slept OK. Bathroom was good, the square sink was a good design feature. The Solamar is at the South end of the Gaslamp Quarter, and there's restaurants and bars on within a short walk. However, I didn't feel entirely comfortable afterdark. Once you realise that the hotel entrance is also the entrance to it's own car park, it's OK to find, and the nearby area is easy to walk and drive in. TV was too large for the small room, it would be OK if it was a flat screen one. Easy access to the trams, convention center, and Horton Plaza. I liked San Diego, it's a great place to visit, and this was an OK hotel. I would go to the Solamar again, nothing actually against it, but if I think I'm not in it's target demographic, which is younger and urban.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: NYCGal1978
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at the Solamar. The good news first....If you like modern boutique hotels, you will be impressed by the decor in both the lobby and the hotel room. Also, if you want to stay in the downtown San Diego area and are debating between hotels like the W and the Sofia, this is definitely the one for you because the Solamar is central to Gaslamp - near the trolleys, restaurants, and shops, while the W and the Sofia are in neighborhoods that are the equivalent of Port Authority in NYC (grungy and technically downtown, but further away from the mainstream and undesirable - I walked by and into both hotels during my stay just out of curiosity). I had requested a room on a high floor facing away from the pool as I had read on here that facing the pool basically means you will get no sleep at any hour of the day. I had called to confirm again the day before that I could get a room facing away on the top floor, but wound up with a room on the top floor facing the pool. I thought that would be fine but it was seriously insane - who has a bar in the middle of a hotel's courtyard with thumping music at all hours? (During the day when you may want to nap before dinner, late at night when you need to catch an early flight...) I'm no grandma - but I do need my sleep eventually, especially since I was in San Diego to tour the area. Its completely ridiculous. Also, the reviews on here that say that the walls are incredibly thin in this hotel are correct. You can hear basically every slamming door and chat in the hallway. That basically negated the whole "chic" experience for me and turned it into a lower end hotel - and this hotel is by no means inexpensive. Missing from this hotel are some of the higher end amenities like a state of the art gym and a bellboy (you drag your own luggage to your room and out of the hotel when you leave). Also there was a general aloofness to the staff. I nearly missed my early flight home because the front desk "forgot" my wake up call which I had requested the night before, and I got better tips on the area and touring advice from a nearby hotel than this one. Again, locationwise and decor-wise, this was definitely a good option, but many of these other characteristics soured the overall experience for me. I guess it depends what you're in San Diego to do.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SFAdam
Reviews.Content: I've generally had good experiences with Kimpton properties but not this time. Perhaps its location - in the Gaslamp District a few blocks from the ballpark - attracts the wrong crowd because I got the impression that most of my fellow lodgers had never stayed outside their homes before and, therefore, had no concept of decorum or consideration of others. Within the first hour of our stay we were subject to some fellows in the room above us hanging out their window and yelling obscenities at passers-by. And at 2 a.m. on the first night of our stay, I felt as if we had accidentally checked into one of the frat houses at UCSD during rush week. The hotel staff was unresponsive to the first incident and slow to respond to the second. San Diego is too competitive a hotel market to put up with lackluster service at a property with an abrasive and abusive clientèle. Next time, I will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: benjip
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location. Kimpton Hotels are always my first choice when I travel (even before I traveled with my dog.) These hotels are pet-friendly, chic, exquisitely decorated, and extremely clean. Located right in the Gaslamp District, I could look into Petco Park from my room, walk to great shopping, restaurants, Embarcadero Park, Seaport Village, the USS Midway, and other fun downtown locations. This hotel does draw a young party crowd to the pool and JSix so it can get noisy. Many of the poolgoers were obviously just there to party and not guests at the hotel. The afternoon wine hour and morning coffee were great and a nice opportunity to enjoy the lobby lounge decor. Positives: morning coffee, afternoon wine, great beds and many pillows, fun decor, clean and spacious rooms, superb housekeeping staff, pet-friendly, location, L'Occitane toiletries, hearing the cheers from the Padres from my room, in-room DVD player. Overall great attention to details, decor, and guest comfort. Negatives: $30/night for parking, incredibly SLOW valet service, horribly designed motor lobby which allowed some clueless idiot to block people in for 10 minutes while he looked at a map, poorly trained staff (didn't know downtown locations, unfamiliar with hotel services), the highly touted dog nightly turndown service is a myth despite being billed on the Kimpton site as well as other online travel sites (I had to call to ask for it on day 3. The staff had no clue but showed up 15 min later with a giant bowl of milkbones and bottled water. Only per my request though.), the partiers seemed a lower class crowd, and other guests who seemed shocked and disgusted that people had dogs in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BAD BAD Service”
Reviews.Author: digitaleagle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with a good rate through Priceline.com Unfortunately this was a big mistake even with the decent room rate we received. First we checked in and there was rampant confusion at the front desk. They had our reservation, and even though we called a couple of weeks ahead of time and were assured we would receive a double bed room, we were told that we would have to settle with a single bed. The room wasn't ready at 4:30pm and we had to wait for over a half hour before we could check in. It seemed like we were the first people they had actually ever checked in. Once we checked in we waited over 1 hour for our room luggage. We were told at the front desk that valet parking was a whopping $30 per night. We then checked out the fitness center and pool. The fitness center would only hold about 3 people max. The pool, if you want to call it that, was more of a wading pool with tons of people drinking and grabbing just about anything they could of their significant other. The service at the bar was just as bad. I ordered a beer after I was told it was "happy hour". A beer was only 4 bucks where I guess I should have been grateful because apparently normally they are 8. I also waited over 1/2 hour because the waitress apparently forgot my order. Our room was small and the first thing I noticed was that the TV was not in working order. I called the desk and even after two days no one bothered to fix it. There were also problems with the shower and we had cracks and holes in the ceiling. (Not something you would expect from a "4" star hotel. There was also some kind of "Chic" rust all over the bathroom walls. (I think they call it dirt back where I live. The sink in the bathroom is very unique. I'm not sure who designed it but you can't shave or do anything without water spilling all over the floor. I guess this is supposed to be "Chic" - but isn't a sink supposed to drain the water away? I have stayed at hotels all over the world and I can assure you this is not one of the better ones. The service is terrible and the rooms are noisy. This hotel caters to 20 something Yuppies who want to party all night long. It was noisy in the hallways and if your were unfortunate enough to have a pool side room, I doubt you would get any sleep all night long. I would rate this hotel a few notches below a Marriott courtyard or a Holiday Inn express. I guess this hotel can justify their ridiculous prices due to the location, but I would highly recommend finding some other place for your stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the pool view room”
Reviews.Author: OutWanderin
Reviews.Content: Very chic hotel with lovely, solicitous staff. The room was large and lovely. Comfortable bed, large screen television, and designer bathroom. So what's the bad news? Our room overlooked the pool/bar area. While the view was pretty, we were treated to loud thumping music EVERY evening and for long stretches of time during the day. The music was so loud that it interfered with the ability to relax, sleep, and even get caught up on paperwork. Unfortunately, we usually request a room away from the elevators to avoid noise. So if you do choose to stay here, make sure that you request a room that overlooks the street (in the opposite direction).

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool”
Reviews.Author: scooterchuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Master Suite for two nights during the week. The check in was smooth, valet service prompt ($30 per day). When we got into our room, it was rather warm, so we turned the AC down to 68 degrees, unpacked and headed out to the streets to find a place for lunch. The Gaslamp Quarter is very cool. There are lots of shops and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. We got back to our room and it really had not cooled down much (after 2 hours!). It was really warm outside for San Diego - 85 degrees, so we left it set mid 60's and went down to the hotel restaurant where we were seated in a wonderful private booth and the service and food was fantastic! The pool is really cool, we had a glass of wine in the evening on the patio and also took advantage of the nightly wine reception in the lobby sitting room - very nice touch! All in all, we thought the hotel was great. The deep fuji soaking/jetted tub in the bathroom with the window looking out to the downtown buildings was a treat each night before bed!!! It's alitte pricey, but well worth it for the room size, service and location.

Reviews.Title: “cool spot for a great escape”
Reviews.Author: mrubiwara
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night, but it was perfect. It's the urban scene but even with two young daughters, it was fun. Super friendly and professional staff, responsive, and room more than adequate for our needs. Pool was great when nobody was there, very relaxing. Parking fee of $30/day a pinch, but after obsserving the local traffic and parking situation, it was worth it. Beautiful decor and tasteful ambiance to be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ltcjoecruz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in downtown San Diego - on the edge of the historic Gaslamp District. If you book a AAA rate, you can save $20-$40 per night and get a large, airy room. Complimentary coffee in the morning and wine in the evening is included in your stay. While not inexpensive, it's a reasonably good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Far Better Options”
Reviews.Author: sgm1
Reviews.Content: The good: (1) A modern funky hotel (2) Well located on the verge of the Gaslamp (3) Evening wine reception and morning coffee (4) Hotel staff are very friendly. (5) Free wireless is always nice. The bad: (1) The hotel rooms are depreciating fast. This was out second visit and within a year the bedroom furniture looks very different. Our white chair was covered in coffee stains and the walls are in need of repair. (2) Avoid the Virtuoso Suites. Our previous standard room was almost as big. The suite we booked this time was dark, the bedroom was tiny and the living room had no natural daylight. The oversized bathtub was nice but other than that nothing very exciting about he room. (3) The pool is a disaster – seating for around 10 people in a relatively large hotel is crazy. It also seems that the pool users are mostly non-guests at the weekend. Locals come to the bar, change in the toilets and use the pool. The pool has a DJ playing very loud music on the weekends. We are in our late 20’s, so don’t get us wrong. But on a Saturday at 12 noon you don’t want music so loud that you can’t talk to the person next to you as you relax by the pool (if you could get a seat that is). (4) Room service. Room service is provided by the onsite (but we were told separately managed) restaurant. We never got what we ordered and when we complained were told ‘too bad.’ One morning they did not have orange juice and decided to send apple juice instead. I declined but was charged anyway! This was just one of a few problems with room service so our advise is to go out for food. (5) Bar. I think this hotel was built as an excuse to have a bar. The bar tends to dominate the hotel and tends to focus on non-hotel guests. We asked if it might be possible to get a table and it was, but only for $250. For San Diego this is a little too much even for the public but you would think that a hotel guest could get a seat without this cost. The worst thing about the bar is the attitude of the bouncers who won’t let hotel guests back to their room to use the toilet. The queue at the bar tends to be long and my wife wanted to go to her room but the bouncer on the hotel exit/entrance told her that if she left she would not be readmitted. This despite the fact that the hotel is directly connected to the bar and this door is used only by hotel guests. So overall, we would save money next time and stay in the Omni down the street. From a prior visit we known that the Omni pool is bigger and far superior, the rooms are nicer and the views are better. We returned to the Solamar because it is smaller and more intimate. But it lacks the characteristics of a small high-end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, great get-away!”
Reviews.Author: crtwrnr
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are just plain fun! Colorful, modern, and check out their leopard print robes in the closet. Literally a stroll away from the trendy gaslamp district, and a short drive from the San Diego Zoo, you can't beat this hotel's location. Plus, they had a complimentary free wine hour every evening, and staying there gives you the priviledge to head up to their very swank rooftop bar that all the kids are lining up to get into. We had a wonderful romantic weekend getaway here, and are ready to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice look, bad chef, bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: TrvlGalTx
Reviews.Content: Its hotels like this that make you question using priceline for a good deal. We ended up getting this hotel twice via priceline. The first time, we were excited to try a new property. The second time, made us wonder if priceline is worth it ... well, it is, but you do take a risk... The hotel has been well renovated. Very contemporary style. Pet friendly - which is nice. The beds were comfortable. So all in all, it was fairly okay. The food and the service were another story all together. There were 5 of us that went down to the hotel restaurant to eat. Of the group, 4 sent back the food. It was truly almost inedible. The only good items on the menu was a soup (which I admit was delicious) and the desserts. We orderd a lamb, which was sent back to be replaced with a ravioli, which was sent back because it was so bad. Two sushi platters, that were less then good. A salad that was so bland, it was like eating grass. On our 2nd trip, we arrived late at night (10.30) and room service closes at 11.00. It took us the 20 minutes to get someone on the phone to place the order (of soup), and then it never came. When we called down at 11.15, we were told "You never placed any order. We are closed." Long story short. Its okay to spend a night, but not much more.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely girls' outing at Solamar!”
Reviews.Author: Racetrackrockabettie
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one fab night at the Solamar 7/22 with 2 girlfriends and was once again reassured by the Kimpton group's commitment to service and style. I have stayed in Kimpton hotels all over the country and Solamar was a gem like the rest. On arrival, our room had not been cleaned yet, so the friendly host at the desk sent us up to JBar to have a round of complimentary martinis. Our room was as I had requested- at pool level, with a wonderful little private terrace accessed by french doors. I sat on the terrace in the hotel-provided zebra bathrobe, reading Truman Capote and drinking wine- bliss! The L'Occitane amenities are a nice touch, and we were provided with extra towels literally moments after we asked for them. Late checkout was a breeze and happily accomodated. The restaurant, though a bit pricy, was delicious. We really couldn't hear the bar noise when we shut the french doors at all, and though our neighbors were partying next door, they were quiet long before the bar shut down. The place is definitely more of a young and hip crowd, which was fine for us. The absence of little kids was actually kind of a relief. I will definitely continue to stay at the Kimpton hotels wherever I go, as the quality and service far surpass other "upscale" venues.

Reviews.Title: “sort of expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: circuitboitravel
Reviews.Content: When I went to check into the hotel, Bruce the front desk supervisor said "we don't have a reservation for you" I gave him my confirmation that I printed from Kimpton. He studied it for 10 minutes plus, and kept trying to find the reservation. I then was told, "Was this a price line booking?" I told him "no, it was a travel agent booking, and I am the travel agent" He then quickly got me a room. It was not the room type that I booked and had to call downstairs to get the room changed, which the hotel did in timely manor. The beds were comfortable, but the towels were the best towels that I have ever experienced in a hotel. The staff was somewhat stuck up. We asked to have a cab called for us, and we were told to walk over to 5th street to get one.

Reviews.Title: “Let Your Hair Down (and put your earplugs in)”
Reviews.Author: KenVicLee
Reviews.Content: In the interest of full disclosure, I signed up for the Kimpton In Touch loyalty program having first been steered to a Kimpton hotel in Washington DC, Hotel George, two years ago. And just last month my wife and I picked the Cypress Hotel in Cupertino, California when we went to see our daugher graduate from Santa Clara. I love the unique things Kimpton does with their boutiquey hotels (most have about 200 rooms) and so signed up for their loyalty program in Cupertino. That being said there are some shortcomings at Hotel Solamar as there probably are with all hotel facilities. Yes, the sink was too shallow (but very artsy-fartsy). Yes, the lighting in the bathroom was too "moody," (dark in the shower, hard to shave in the poorly lit mirror, no fan to extract the moisture from a hot shower). And yes, the music out of our tenth floor window looking down on "the 20-something scene" below thumped all night. We came prepared, however. We were in San Diego with two other couples to attend the Padres baseball game. The other two couples were staying at the adjacent Marriott and were paying more ($259.00 as versus our $229.00) for less service. We grabbed our moment to have a drink at the Hotel Solamar bar by meeting the other two couples there for pre-game drinks, before the hip crowd arrived. We always travel with ear plugs so the noise wasn't an issue later on. We are accustomed to the expensive parking fees in that area. But we love the high thread count sheets with the exquisite decorating that Kimpton's do. We like the personal attention their staff gives and their promptness in rendering service. When we needed our car to get called up to go golfing, it was there when we got downstairs. When we called our friends to see where they were, they were still waiting for someone to bring their car around. Everyone from the reception folks to the bell men were anxious to please and engaged in dialogue. I did check around before booking my hotel for this baseball game. We wanted to be within walking distance of Petco Park and the Gaslamp district. The Omni (where we have stayed twice) was quoting $299.00 for this weekend unless you had purchased their baseball special (which had no availability when I checked). The Gaslamp Marriott was at $259.00, the Convention Center Marriott was at $289.00 and originally Hotel Solamar was at $319.00. But with Triple A (or AARP) the rate declined to $239.00 and the loyalty program took another $10.00 a night off. Cheaper price for a more hip environment with better service???...no brainer. I let my hair down (and put my earplugs in). .

Reviews.Title: “Pool area not intended for guests”
Reviews.Author: traveler2376
Reviews.Content: Pool is 20ft x 8ft x3ft deep, stricktly for a quick dip. The photos are decieving, those cool looking cabanas are FOR RENT ONLY and not for the general use of the hotel guests, which only leaves FOUR yes only 4 lounge chairs for and open area rated for "448 person maximum capacity". Very odd untill you realize that the pool area is actually an open to the public night/day club. Music is loud day and night and the pool area gets very very cowded. The chairs are dirty and if you take two towels(one to cover the dirty chair and the other for drying use if you are adventurous enough to dip in the pond) the maid might chase you down and reprimand you( by the way, pool towels are hidden in the tiny hard to find gym and you have to get them yourself). Manager was apologetic but otherwise useless. Room was clean and comfortable, but watchout for the towels (again)they will take the clean extra towels and leave you with the towel you already used, this happend every day. We had to "steal" extra towels from the gym, please don't tell on me or the maid will hunt me down again. Those persistent maids WILL walk in on you even though you have the "do not disturb" sign hanging from the door, so unless you are an exhibitionist, be clothed when you go to bed. The location is great, walking distance to everything, night clubs. restaurants, and even a movie theater which is more serene than the Hotel's pool area. The gym is tiny. Two treadmills, an eliptical and a few weights that is it. The Jsix restaurant is awesome, food and service. My girl and I stayed here four days, next time we will stay elsewhere. Maybe the omni next door...

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection”
Reviews.Author: chillijilli
Reviews.Content: We are experienced travelers, having lived in Tokyo for 6 yrs and Dusseldorf for 4. We presently split our time between Grand Cayman and AZ. I say all this because we have been fortunate to have been exposed to some very top of the line hotels worldwide, so I feel I can offer some valid comparisons. Previously while in San Diego, we have stayed at both the Omni and the Marriott downtown. Available downtown hotel rooms were limited on the night we needed, so I booked first and read tripadvisor afterward. That's the reverse of my usual procedure. I was more than concerned by the alleged flea issues, and I suppose arrived expecting some kind of disguised claptrap. Also, because we are middle aged, I thought we might feel out of place in a world of trendy twentysomethings. Was I in for a surprise! Yes, the hotel is pet friendly, as almost ALL European hotels are, even the most fashionable. (Remember, Oprah won't travel without her dogs and if a place is good enough for Oprah, it's good enough for me.) I only saw one pet; a small poodle type, adoringly held by it's owner and swaddled in pink accessories. Hotel Solamar was immaculate. From the strikingly designed lobby area to the designer-inspired rooms, the place exuded sophisticated ambience. The staff was friendly, helpful, and professional at all times and went out of the way to make our stay exceptionally enjoyable. The location is perfect: just steps away from the wonderful restaurants in Gaslamp, and a 2 block walk to Petco Park. Since my husband is a huge baseball fan, I planned a surprise B-Day celebration, and therefore had some special needs. Initially, I asked for a room with a view of the baseball park, and even though we made our reservations through Hotwire, Chip went out of his way to accomodate us. I also had to engage the services of the concierge, Christian. The cake ordered from Extraordinary Desserts (beyond belief!) and 2 special-recipe blended drinks we invented in Cayman were waiting for us in our room following the Padres game. I think every single staff member we encountered wished my husband a Happy B-Day and went way beyond expectations to be sure we had a positive experience. I actually had to force a small gratuity into Christian's hand, as nobody wanted to accept a tip for what I thought was amazing service! They all just said the reward for them was the great fun they had participating in such a surprise! There's a nightly free wine tasting---as many glasses as you like. The pool area is on the 4th level, and lovely. It's quite active around Happy Hour. If you're looking for upscale lodging, with a unique sophisticated atmosphere in a sometimes overly branded world, I highly recommend this excellent hotel! The staff is so exceptional that they truly rank among the best we've encountered anywhere in the world. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Very Different!”
Reviews.Author: hepsales
Reviews.Content: Our travel plans worked in such a manner that we spent one night at the San Diego Omni and the following night at Hotel Solamar. The Omni gets our vote hands-down, but we'd give Hotel Solamar a high ranking also. On the positive side, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the entire surroundings very clean. There is complimentary wine for an hour in the evening as well as complimentary coffee in the morning -- both in an area right off the lobby. On the negative side, parking runs $30 a night (!!) and there is no gift shop or vending machines from which to purchase a can of soda or a snack to eat. There were limited chairs around the pool -- all of which were taken. The decor is very art deco which may appeal to many, but not necessarily to us. Overall, however, the stay was a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: srizzuto
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel thru Hotwire and had never heard of it, so was a little leary given some of the reviews here. Turns out, it IS a pretty nice place. The valet/bell/checkin services were top-notch upon checkin and the room was nice. Parking was $30/night, plus all those tips. But that's what you get in a big downtown city. From there, the service got patchy. The oddest thing was that there was no dresser in the room. So we asked for a room that had one, (my husband is an unpack, move in guy) and the next day they put us in a larger room, but still no dresser. There is a small closet, but you end up living out of your suitcase. We asked a housekeeper and she said there were no dressers in the hotel. There was no phone book in the room, and it took 3 calls to get one. Newspaper service was patchy, some days it was there and some days it wasn't. One day after I called for one, a huge THUD hit the door; that was kind of rude. The bathroom is not well-lit and the sink is too shallow. All in all it was ok, and if I found another great deal, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for pet owners”
Reviews.Author: snuffles13
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. In the Gaslamp district 2. New, trendy decor (with one caveat, see below) 3. Friendly staff and guests Cons: 1. Parking expensive (which we already knew about before going thanks to reading these reviews) 2. Valet service sketchy and be prepared to wait up to 15 mins before they retrieve your car. It is best to always call for your car ahead of time to decrease the wait time. The hotel offers valet parking to the public as well (not just hotel patrons) so it can get really busy at times-eg Friday nights. 3. The new bathroom sinks are pretty but not practical. The sinks are too shallow so water splashes all over the place. If you are short, it's impossible to wash your face without hitting your head on the facut.. Finally, the hotel caters to pet owners and offers turn down service and daycare for dogs and cats. Bring benadryl if you have allergies. The sheets were itchy the first night, but after having them replaced, they were OK.

Reviews.Title: “Way too loud, stay there to party”
Reviews.Author: rataturium
Reviews.Content: We were placed in a room that overlooked the pool which we thought was great, until we realized that meant noise streaming into our top floor room all night long. If you are young and want to party this is a good choice, otherwise look elsewhere. We requested a quieter room and were told that there were none.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Funky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fomayin
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Solamar on Hotwire... and after I saw the other reviews here, I was a bit concerned. I understand why some of the other reviewers disliked the Hotel Solamar, but it's a fun place, in the gaslamp quarter. You just have to know how to do it! As other reviewers have mentioned, the pool area / bar becomes a happening spot weekend nights. If you like that kind of atmosphere, go! If you don't want a part of that, or want to be able to leave it behind to sleep (before about 2AM), then request a room on a high floor that faces away from the pool. Rooms on the fourth floor are loud, as are rooms that face the pool. Also, as the pool is tiny, and is 21+ only after 9, and for other reasons too, this is not the best choice for families with younger children. Although, the gaslamp quarter is not the best place for families with young children, probably, anyway. Not because it's unsafe or anything -- there's just not that much for the younger crowd to do. Hotel Solamar is pet-friendly, and so there will be guests with their dogs. I didn't once notice any problem... no odors, no pet hairs, no bugs... But, if you are allergic or extremely sensitive -- go somewhere else. Evenings from 5 to 6 is wine & beer tasting, where they have a few types of wine and (typically only one) beer -- usually from local wineries/breweries. They don't always tell people this when they check in... but you should try it out, it's a free drink, plus an opportunity to meet the other people visiting that week. Also, others reported paying $300+/night for rooms here. I booked on hotwire and paid about half that. Of course, you never know for sure what you're going to get.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: alisa110
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute trip and the rates were great. Overall, Hotel Solamar was great. The staff was professional and friendly. The bathroom didn't have much lighting and no vents in the bathroom, but the room and the hotel was very clean. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Solamar -- nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: dmurphy
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate for 2 nights at Hotel Solamar through their website, and the hotel is definitely hip and urban. It's in a great location -- right near the baseball stadium, in the Gaslamp Quarter. The room was stylish and comfortable. Service from the font desk was pretty good -- they had a lot of good recommendations for dinners and getting around. Only have 2 complaints, which didn't make a huge impact on the trip, just worth mentioning.We reserved a king size bed, but on check-in they only had queens, so we were a little disappointed there. The other thing was about parking -- they have valet service, for about $30/day. We thought that was pricey and asked if there were any other options. The girl at the desk responded with a pretty firm 'no'. Now either she didn't know the area, or was trying to swindle us --- but we walked less than 2 blocks down and found a huge parking garage that charged less than $10 a day. For a larger hotel, it was a nice stay (we usually stay in B&Bs) -- they do have a nice rooftop deck bar with great views.

Reviews.Title: “Flees and Thieves”
Reviews.Author: bogueplayer
Reviews.Content: This is a nice and trendy looking hotel, but be warned... The housekeeping will steal your valuables and there are flees in the hotel. Some money and my gold ring was stolen from the room i was in. No forced entry, so i am assuming it was a hotel staff who has access to the rooms. Also, my gf got biten from flees and bugs in the room. I will never stay at a place that allows pets again. A learning experience for the both of us. Avoid Hotel Solamar in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: profgjay
Reviews.Content: Hotel Solamar is another winner from the Kimpton chain. The decor is eccentric but stylish, with a very contemporary feel. Service was outstanding all around, from the attentive car valets and desk manager to the quick service in the wonderful restaurant. I particularly loved the 4th floor pool/bar oasis. Warning: this is a dipping pool, really, quite small and not meant for lap swimming or more than a few people at a time. Still it was refreshing after a day of hot touring. If you want real quiet, make sure to request a room facing away from the pool courtyard. We did, and got a great room on the top floor facing towards the Petco stadium, where we watched the fireworks after the Padres victory. The location puts you right in the middle of the Gaslamp district of restaurants and bars and minutes from the trolley and convention center.

Reviews.Title: “A San Diego Favorite”
Reviews.Author: boosparkles
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this hotel. It's my favorite to stay at in San Diego. Trendy and comfortable. I love the roof top bar on the weekends. The staff was ultra-friendly and extremely helpful in directions, restaurant recommendations and just their overall customer service. Valet parking is a little expensive, but easy access and friendly attendants.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: WADoc
Reviews.Content: From the moment of check in this Hotel fell short of all expectations. I don't know how so many positive reviews have been submitted for this place. The front desk was simply rude, they didn't have the room I reserved and put me on the loud stinky fourth floor. Then, they changed the room key code and locked me out the following evening, they explained they had a new room and had locked me out of my existing room so I'd come to the desk. Whatever happened to leaving a message on the phone? I had to go down to the lobby at 11:00 PM to get a new key. Room service was terrible, dry cereal arrived with only a fork, and no milk. Several requests were never followed up on by either the housekeeping staff or front desk. The only positive service at this hotel is provided by the valets. (The parking is 30.00 per day) I paid 535.00 per night for a king room including taxes and parking. The rooms are poorly designed, no dresser and only one tiny night stand drawer so business travelers can plan to leave personal clothing items on the floor. The bathroom design is not functional, the sink is so shallow it splashed back water all over the place. When I turned on the hot water at the sink it sounded like a jack hammer in the wall. Do yourself a favor, don't stay here unless you want to party like a 20 year old your entire stay. The hotel is wide open for non-hotel guests at the outside bar, the noise never ends between 5:00 and midnight, then it travels to the street below the room windows and spills into the hallways. This hotel is "hip", but that's all it's got going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky, classy hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: bice710
Reviews.Content: I had a friend who lives in San Diego recommend this hotel as she had hung out there one night. We were traveling through and spent the night there. The hotel staff is fantastic...so friendly and at the top of their game. It's within walking distance of the gaslamp and Horton plaza shopping mall. Actually, it's perfect because it's far enough from the Gaslamp noise but only a couple blocks' walk. This is a Kimpton Hotel by the way, so if you love their style, this is another great example of it. Ultra-chic and very stylish. Lobby is beautiful and there's a fun little sitting area with a big fireplace. Our room was overlooking the pool and bar. The bed was very comfortable and they also upgraded us to an "extended tub"...it was an extra-long jacuzzi tub. Interesting, I'm not sure what the benefit of extra-long was because it didn't fit 2 any better than a regular bathtub, oh well. :) They do have FUN animal print bathrobes...I so wanted to take one but they were custom for the hotel and I'm sure it would have cost about $200! We went down to the pool bar area and again, very swanky with long couches and big bowl firepits all over. Partial view of the city, very cool. One weird thing was that they wouldn't let us smoke over by the firepits (against the edge of the building) but we could smoke at the bar, where all the other people were sitting. Wouldn't it be the other way around? Anyway, all in all we loved the hotel and would definitely stay again. By the way, they are a very pet-friendly hotel if you have pets.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and hip”
Reviews.Author: mrcowan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Solamar for two nights and had wonderful time. Rooms are nice and bed is comfortable. The room was just tad crowded and no room if you have a lot clothes there isn't any storage space besides the closet. Loved the bathroom. Service was great and I loved the Pool area. I have stayed at Omni twice. If you can't get view of water at Omni. Go with Hotel Solamar.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: nails4
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through Priceline and got a great deal. We stayed for 6 days during the last week of March. To start, we were welcomed by a very friendly staff. We arrived at 10 a.m. and the hotel accomodated us by letting us check in and immediately go to our room. Every employee we dealt with was very professional and charming. Make sure to check out the FREE wine and beer tasting from 5 to 6 every night. The best feature of the hotel was the 4th floor bar (Jbar) and pool. The atmosphere at night was very hip and popular, while during the day the pool was very tranquil. I highly reccomend staying at this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: norcalbackpacker
Reviews.Content: We were looking at UC San Diego, and wanted a hotel near the airport as we were flying out early in the morning. The Hotel Solamar was an ideal place to stay. Located in the charming Gas Lamp area of San Diego within blocks of many restaurants and the trolley cars. The front desk staff was extremely accommodating even though I booked the room through priceline. We were provided a room on the top floor with two queens instead of a King even though the hotel did not have to provide this for us. The room was immaculate, and very modern in decor. We loved the special touches like the hosted wine/beer hour from 5-6, and how close the hotel was to everything in the Gas Lamp quarter of San Diego. We walked to a great restaurant, and felt very safe. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy & Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Annettesb
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our weekend in San Diego for our anniversary. I was in heaven when I was there. The Staff from moment we walked in until the time we left was amazing! They all were helpful, polite and very friendly. We stayed in the corner king suite. The room was beautiful. We got to go to the bar at the pool and ate dinner at Jsix. The dinner was absoutly yummy. We got special service because of our anniversary! The chef sent us a compliment of one of his creations. This place was off the charts. Take a look at this place when you visit San Diego. I give five stars. Thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: CherryDerby
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Solamar. Friendly helpful staff, the hotel was stylish and relaxed. Our room was at the back, very comfortable, the bathroom was impressive. The location was near to the trolley which you could take to Seaport village. The Gaslamp area was great for eating out with a lively but friendly atmosphere. We would love to visit again but would probably choose a hotel overlooking the sea next time for a change of location.

Reviews.Title: “The Solamar with Small Children (mid-week)”
Reviews.Author: iname2000
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews for this hotel after having made the reservation, I was very worried about staying here with my two children under 4. However, unlike what is mentioned in some reviews, we never felt out of place with our children. The hotel definitely caters to the well-dressed hip-crowd but having children does not automatically put us on the other end of the hip spectrum. Now this may have to do with the fact that we arrived on a Sunday and left on a Wednesday but all of the hotel's facilities - including the pool bar and especially the restaurant - were very well suited for children. All staff was extremely friendly and The location was phantastic, too, as you are right in middle of the "Gaslamp District", which is great for walking around. There is also a bookstore close by in case you encounter some bad weather like we did. To sum it up, we were really, really pleased with this hotel and the phenomenal service, which we received. We would most definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay...not a cookie cutter hotel like the rest”
Reviews.Author: JackPo21
Reviews.Content: Very upscale hotel in a great location near the baseball stadium and convention center. Walking distance to dozens of great restauarants in the Gaslamp area. Hotel was very hip and chic, especially the rooftop pool and bar. Probably more suitable for a younger crowd but there were some families with kids who really loved the pool. I got the room mid week on Priceline for 125.

Reviews.Title: “This place ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: Zonabill
Reviews.Content: I just completed a 2 night stay at the Solomar and couldn't be happier! I'll start with the staff. They were all very friendly, helpful and actually seemed to take pride in their jobs! This started the moment we exited our cab (Even though we arrived prior to 8:00 A.M., check in is at 3:00 P.M.) with the doorman and continued with EVERY employee we encountered for the duration of our stay. The people at the front desk were all very friendly and helpful with local info. When I requested a coffee maker from housekeeping it arrived at our door (With a smile) in about 5 minutes. The rooms decor was very relaxing and had everything I needed from internet access to one of the most comfortable beds I've ever had in a hotel. In fact, it was comfortable to the point that I'll be replacing my own bed within the month. The linens were all of superior quality and seemed to be almost new. In the cleanliness department the only fault I could find would be the windows (This is nit picking as I have been told it had recently rained), other than that the place was immaculate to the point that there weren't even any watermarks in the tub, sink or on any of the fixtures. The other 2 things I'd like to cover is the location (PERFECT!!) and the construction noise. In short, there wasn't any even though there were 3 active construction sites visible within a couple of blocks of my room (520). When I had the window closed the outside world just seemed to disappear. I will definitively be visiting this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaLove_travelling
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets it all! Rich interior. Better than some of the five star hotels I've stayed in. Quick Service. Perfect for a romantic get away. Try it out yourself. I bet you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: CharlesLondon1
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay! The room was very nice, staff was very friendly and the location was perfect. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: balancedhart13
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure where we wanted to stay in the Gaslamp district, just somewhere really nice. So we booked a 4 star + on hotwire in the area we wanted. I have used this method many times, and haven't been disappointed yet....So when I got the designation that the hotel we would be staying at (the Solamar) and checked it against your reviews, I was terified! We were going for my freinds 50th birthday, we are far from 20 somethings that most of the reviewer stated the hotel catered to. What an incredibly wonderful surpise it was that the hotel was one of the most wonderful stays we have had. I travel often on business and pleasure, and I can be a tough critic...But from the moment we arrived we were met with wonderful attentive service! From the valet that took our car, to the bellman who helped with our luggage to the most wonderful front desk help to the maid service to the room service all were top notch! The view was spectacular from the 10th floor! The 2 highlights for us were the Beer & Wine reception, (wonderful atmosphere and tasty local fare) and the hotel staff! After reading some of the prior reviews on the hotel, I was amaze at how wonderfully warm, fun, and helpful they all were! Especially our check-in coordinator - Deme - he was wonderful, friendly and ever so enthusiastic -I recommend you ask for him personally!!!! Loved our stay!!! Will definately stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: skydisaster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for our 10th anniversary. It was wonderful. The rooms were quiet and very comfortable. The location was great. We were a block from the trolley. We walked to everything in the gaslamp district. We could see Petco Park from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aefaboy
Reviews.Content: Kudos Hotel Solamar! Trendy, upscale and warm. We've stayed in many hotels from NYC to San Francisco and Hotel Solamar competes!!!!! Wonderful decor and excellent service. Had no issues with the Bar or noise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: alfie92
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Solamar hotel as part of our tour down the west coast, we have been to San diego before but we wanted to stop in the city and not on the hotel circle. We loved the hotel, its location just 2 blocks to the Gaslamp area, the rooms were spacious very clean. The restaurant in the hotel J6 was very good we had 1 evening meal there, and we went every morning for breakfast. We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights over a weekend it was very busy and has mentioned in previous reviews the hotel roof bar is very busy with both locals and visitors , our room was overlooking the city so when we went to bed we heard no noise, but i imagine if you had a room overlooking the pool it would be noisy till late! also another point, we decided to go to the pool sunday afternoon for a spot of sunbathing, when we arrived it was very busy but it was like a chilled club night! The above points didnt spoil our stay and i would definately stay at the Solamar again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Solamar is Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: CentaurNC
Reviews.Content: We went to San Diego for my birthday and we had an amazing time. Part of the reason was this hotel. We stayed on the 8th floor and the room could not have been better! The bed was amazingly comfortable, the room was large, and the cleaning staff kept the room spotless (even so much as perfectly arranging the curtains each day). The staff was friendly and the bell-staff was always ready to help with the car no matter the hour. This is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want to sleep at night”
Reviews.Author: AnonTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a hip, trendy hotel with a terrible service. Do not stay here if you want to sleep at night. There is a bar on the second floor by the pool, which is a popular hangout and when we stayed there on a Friday night, they played loud music until well past midnight. We simply could not sleep that night. We called several times to the front desk to complain and they did nothing other than to apologize. Moreover, after the bar closed, the party-goers made big noises in the hallway (I guess they were staying at the hotel) and interruptted our sleep even longer. It was just one of the most umpleasant stays we've had to endure. Don't be fooled by the nice ambiance and spend your dollars elsewhere. By the way the restaurant JSix, which is located on the first floor of this hotel, was excellent. We had a very good breakfast the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Smallhill
Reviews.Content: Overpriced hotel in trendy old town area of San Diego. Rooms are comfortable. Restaurants are limited. Room service food selections very limited, and they charge 20% service plus delivery fee. Parking charge is $26 per day. Wireless internet connection in room is very unstable, frequently breaking off. Service is friendly in a formal, phony way. Not worth $300+ per day. Do yourself a favor, you can get much better value in San Diego than this.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - fab location”
Reviews.Author: ash2020
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego for a week and on check in they seemed surprised that we were staying for so long - guess it is just a short stay place. The room we had was a great size with all mod cons and funky design. The staff were friendly and went out of their way to help - even exchanging travellers cheques which was a service that they didn't usually provide! Hotel is situated in an excellent location a block a way from 5th street where all the funky shops/restaurants and bars are (also they are building the Hard Rock Hotel at the end of the street so this will bring even more life to the area when it opens next year). The food and drink is priced accordingly - the portions are large and you are paying for the location as everywhere else we ate/drank around the gasslamp was similarly priced. The pool area was quiet during the day and the bar was only busy on a Friday and Saturday night but closed at midnight - some friends had a room over looking the pool/bar and said that the noise was not an issue. If i ever go back to San Diego then i will def be staying at the Solamar!

Reviews.Title: “Geat Option”
Reviews.Author: Ed05
Reviews.Content: After saying at the over rated Omni this place was great.Friendly staff,huge room with all the amenities anyone would want.,CD player, well stocked mini bar( including condoms and lube). This place does try go for the party crowd but this should not put anyone off . The rooms are welli insulated. The J bar on the roof was lovely, but my only complaint wasit was difficult to get a seat or table because so may non hotel guests use it. They should limit the numbers allowed up, especially during the day. Had brunch at the J six, which was good but nothing special. Like the free wine hour in the library area. Great idea

Reviews.Title: “If you're in your 20s with no kids, this is the place for you.”
Reviews.Author: normella
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I celebrated our birthdays from August 25th to August 28th at the Hotel Solamar. Beforehand, I read all the reviews and, while many of them were negative, I suddenly realized why. All the people reviewing negatively were either older or had kids with them. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were greeted by valet (parking for 24 bucks is not too cool, but whatever). The guys were very attentive and nice the whole weekend. We stayed on the 7th floor, overlooking the Gaslamp District. We never ended up going to the pool bar but it was no biggie. Room service was prompt and very friendly, and the front desk was helpful with recommendations of good restaurants and bars to head to at night. The room was beautiful! We stayed in the king spa suite and I couldn't have asked for anything more wonderful. The tub was big enough for two, the decor was modern and fabulous, and the bed was super comfortable. Overall, I had a great time. I was expecting less because of all the reviews but I have some words of advice. Please don't go to the Hotel Solamar if you have children. For the sake of your good time, their good time, and single people's good time, it might be better to book a room at a more family-friendly spot. But, considering the hotel is centered in the middle of the bars and clubs of San Diego, this is exactly what you would expect. I couldn't have had a better time.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it says on the tin!!”
Reviews.Author: sm16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Friday 25th -Monday 28th August and the previous reviews are spot on. Firstly let me say that I have not got a problem with the twentysomethings around the pool and the fact that it is hectic to say the least - I just wish the Solamar advertised the fact. The good points are very good: 1 Location Fantastic location - an easy stroll to the harbour, near all the restaurants and bars in the Gaslamp area (if you like fish you must try McCormick and Shmidt at the Omni on the same street - wonderful catfish)and if your going to a Padres game, its aroundthe corner. 2. Rooms Our room had a pool view (we will come to that later!!!) and was large, clean and very pleasant. Big bed and a lounger were good. 3. Facilities Gym was small and got crowded very easily. Had breakfast in the restaurant which was very nice. Wine tastin is a must. Early evening for an hour. Worth noting however that if its not busy (as with the Sunday of our stay) they dont hang around. Around ten mins to go and they had took all the wine and no one was around to get anymore. Now the problems. There really is only one problem with the hotel and that is if you go to the hotel at the weekends and you not looking for that type of atmosphere (ie loud music, loud people, no room, bouncers on the door) then forget it. Its like that all day long and goes right the way through the night. This also means that if you have a pool view room get some earplugs - your gonna need em!! I agree with some of the other reviews in that the hotel just does not seem to know what it wants to be. To be fair we got a very good deal through Priceline but if we had paid full price - we would not have been happy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Confused Hotel”
Reviews.Author: grahamc100
Reviews.Content: Like many of the people who hang out here, the Hotel Solamar is trying to figure out what it wants to be. We stayed over Labor Day Weekend and I have to agree with most of the other recent reviewers. First the good: location, location, location. It's an easy walk to the many restaurants of the Gaslamp District, an easy walk to Petco Park and an easy walk to Seaport Village. Our 9th floor corner room was said to have a 'lot more room than our normal rooms." I'd hate to see the normal rooms, then. There was literally no space to put clothes. One small drawer on one side of the bedside, and a mini-drawer under the mini-bar. Even smaller was the bathroom. There was no place to hang a hand-towel. We couldn't find room for our own toilet items. And the sink had good form, but no function. The biggest disappointment was the hotel staff. Pleasant but it felt like they were in WAY over their heads. We asked for directions to two nearby restaurants and they had no clue. There was no concierge to ask, since the hotel doesn't have one. When we asked for information on nearby tourist sites, once again they had none. So, I finally asked the front desk if I could see a phone book to look up a number and was told, "Sorry, we don't have one." There was a Padres game Sunday afternoon, and since it was a holiday weekend, the pool area was packed starting around 3:00 with people who wanted to drink to get drunk. There was no way to use the pool, which shouldn't seem like a lot to ask for rooms going over $350/night. Finally, try to find out how recently a dog stayed in your room. While I was at the desk trying to get a phone book, three different people called, asking for a room change. One was because of the noise from the pool, the other two were because of the animal smells. This is a good place to stay, if you don't plan on spending much time in the hotel, or you don't want any help from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “No tranquility”
Reviews.Author: DRS1
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the Solamar's website, there was nothing tranquil about my stay, with the exception of the beds. As others mentioned, this is a hipster hotel, tailored more around the bar scene than the guests. While there was security at the elevators, I'm not sure what they were there for, other than to stop a brawl. No one had to provide proof they were guests. Anyone could go on the elevators, and had access to all floors. Very unsafe. There was no possibility of having a relaxing time at the pool, since it is really a bar/club scene with blaring music, and lots of non-guests hogging the space. Rooms were nice, beds were comfy, but if your room faces the pool, don't plan on sleeping until the bar closes. Not at all a satisfying experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay- Hotel Solamar was flawless!”
Reviews.Author: tammigop
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, the Hotel Solamar was perfect. A welcomed addition to downtown San Diego. The bell staff was extremely attentive, and check in was flawless. I was shown to my King Deluxe Spa room, and it was awesome. The colors were very well paired- chocolate brown and light blue- my favorites! I decided upon arrival to have a massage in my room. I called the concierge, and had a massage therapist at my door in an hour!! The soaking tub was a great treat, (although tough to navigate if you're short like me!).. The amenities were all Aveda, and well sized! It is true, the pool/bar area is totally chic- and NOT suitable for families/kids- which I think is one of the best features of this hotel! Its just nice to have an oasis in San Diego thats relatively kid-free. Spent an entire afternoon out at the pool- it was like heaven. I cannot recommend this place enough- stay here if you think you're cool enough!

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel That Caters To the Party Crowd”
Reviews.Author: PlanBauer
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Ritz, the Quality Inn, and all levels in between. As with any other hotel, one needs to select the hotel based upon the proper mindset and occasion. Hotel Solamar has quite mixed reviews and I was very apprehensive prior to arriving. I'm pleased to say that I can understand why it does have these mixed reviews - people are choosing this hotel for the wrong reason. Solamar is located on the edge of Gaslamp District, which is known for a party atmosphere - the exact reason why I visted the area, a nice wkend to relax with the Missus. Anyhow, Solamar does cater to a younger, "party" crowd, and if you book here, that should be what you are looking for. If you are looking for a place to conduct business or go to sleep at 9pm, this is not your hotel. Staff was very friendly and accomodating, although a formal concierge service would be nice.

Reviews.Title: “posh and trendy, wild weekends”
Reviews.Author: brahmagupta
Reviews.Content: The room was so modern and the decor was very fun. I enjoyed the atmosphere at the hotel and the staff was very courteous. Our room was cleaned early in the day and it felt very clean. We had wanted two beds, but only a King was left, but we were upgraded to a corner room which was very large. Our room overlooked the pool/club area. It was a nice view. The bathroom was very nicely appointed with quality features, but the lighting was very soft. It was nice and calm in the morning until time to take a close look in the mirror and apply makeup and the it was just too dark in there. I was surprised there wasn't better lighting or a better fan. The wallpaper was ubsosrbing all the moisture, which might lead to problems later with mold. We were greeted professionally by the desk upon our arrival. We were offered a roll away, but ended up being fine sharing a bed with my daughter. The bed was VERY comfortable. We had no trouble with the parking, (valet only $24 a day) we were always noticed by the tag in our window and given priority parking and service as hotel guests. On the weekend the club seems to be one of the hottests places to be. THe lobby was filled with security people and the elevators. THere were people posing a guests of the hotel trying to get into the club sneaking around the hotel. It was uncomfortable to be a hotel guest with all these other people lurking around. We went to our room and the minibar hadn't been restocked, my daughter wasn't feeling well and wanted a sprite. We went to go find one from a soft drink machine. We couldn't find a machine, so we made our way down stairs. Maybe there was one on the floor of the pool/gym but the area was full of people all dressed up and so we didn't feel comfortable getting off there in our "loungewear" to look. We asked a few people where we could get a soft drink, but they told us they were all security. We finally went to the frontdesk and were told they would send us up one in 5 minutes, but it never came up. This hotels seems to be two different places, a nice hotel of qualilty service during the day, but the weekend nights seem to be all about the club, and servicing it. THe hotel guests are not the main focus of service, or at least that was our experience. I had been moving my daughter in all day, and was looking forward to a quite soak and swim, which is a usual relaxing experienceat a hotel, but we came back to 200 people surround the pool, which became part of the decor and atmosphere of the club, not something accessible to hotel guests. It seems to me they need to decide what they want to be or offer another area for hotel guests to enjoy. For the price, for a hotel guest to be made to feel like an outsider and second for service was shocking. It is a nice place, just know what to expect and a quiet weekend of being pampered won't be it. Also, I noticed men taking "women" up to their rooms from the club, which seemed a bit awkward and like a skanky Vegas hotel instead of a nice clean upscale hotel. It was a strange mix, but over all during the week I would say it is one of the best hotels in SD. During the weekend expect a party scene, with noise until 1 am easily.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel Well done but dont stay on Saturday with kids!!”
Reviews.Author: chad44
Reviews.Content: Very nice service.....small rooms though.....wow the 4th floor bar is packed!! Im in my early 30's with a 7 year old daughter and saturday night is nuts.....people everywhere...i didn't mind it my daughter didn't mind it...although she wanted to swim and couldn't...until sunday....the crowd was not near as big on sunday...we enjoyed the roof bar/pool it was fun....i'd stay there again but not on a saturday night with a kid!!! But overall a very nice place!!

Reviews.Title: “The WORST Hotel Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: cpais
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst experience I have ever had at any hotel. First it started with valet telling me their lot was full, and I would have to park across the street. Just as I was about to pay the meter, I realized all cars would be towed between the hours of 2am-6am. I came back and told the valet manager my distress of having to worry about my car being towed. He then informed me, he was not aware of that rule because he did not work that "lot", then suggested I just keep driving around and find a "self-parking" garage. Infuriated and deeply frustrated, since I had booked 3 rooms for the weekend for a bachelorette party, I asked to speak to the hotel manager, who also told me that she was "sorry" and unfortunately the lot was full, blah, blah , blah. Dinner by the pool consisted of bad food and even badder service. Since when was snooty and rude service meant a place was "cool"? Although the ambiance was nice, the service from numerous employees was so atrocious it definitely tainted the experience. Tried to have breakfast at (JSix) the hotel's restaurant the next morning and was told that it would take 20 minutes to sit 7 people and another 20 minutes to sit another 7...so "maybe we should consider going elsewhere". Wow! I thought I was on candid camera...because I couldn't believe it. I would never ever recommend staying at this hotel. There are many other trendy and chic hotels with better customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: KristaLB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Solamar 7/6-9 and had a great time. Granted we fall into the 30 something/bar crowd so my opinion is different from the other reviewers. The hotel and rooms are very modern and clean. I never even saw someone with a pet. The bar around the the pool is a great place to relax and people watch. It's in walking distance to Seaport Village and all the great restaurants and bars in the Gaslamp Quarter. We ate at Croce's one night which was excellent! The hotel food is good but overpriced (like most hotel restaurants). The only negative was we had returned to our room at 5 one evening and housekeeping had not come yet.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about the Solamar”
Reviews.Author: annekr
Reviews.Content: My 17 year old daughter and I arrived on a Thursday. We had booked the accommodation through Virgin Holidays and requested a twin (two bedded room) but on arrival were advised that they didn't have may of these and we would have to share. Disappointing but no major disaster. Pool area was lovely and friendly that afternoon. However as the weekend crowd arrived from Friday onwards it became impossible to get a seat by the pool and as mentioned by others it was uncomfortable to go swimming with the non resident crowd dominating the bar/pool area. The evening wine reception was a welcome bonus and the hotel location was excellent for shopping and eating out. Saw a few dogs around the place but there was no evidence of fleas or odours where we were. The complementary internet access was a bonus. Staff not very geared to tourists however with poor knowledge and information on trolley bus etc. I would stay again if not at weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Families Can Do Better!”
Reviews.Author: Looking
Reviews.Content: It's probably not appropriate for a hotel to advertise that it is for 20-somethings (some are 30 but act 20) who want to be seen in a trendy spot, but that's Hotel Solamar. I hestitate to poorly review any hotel that has some bright spots, but for a family with teens (or children), you have to dig deep to enjoy. There's a definite "air" of "what are you doing here" if you have children. (I bet seniors are treated with the same arrogance.) The lobby is chic & lovely, but the desk help are so sophisticated that they have trouble being courteous to the guests who don't fit the bill. The rooms are decorated nicely, but pity the hotel workers who have to clean the "pet stuff". (If you have a sensitive nose, you will notice the aroma in the halls & your room.) It is expensive to park at the hotel ($24/ night), but the hotel workers who get your car are fabulous (quick & accomodating). The restaurant is beautiful and has expensive but delicious food. The hotel is in a nice location for Gas Lamp, Convention Center, Horton Plaza, etc. You can walk or take one of the many bicylces (rickshaw-style, sorry about the spelling) to get anywhere around the city. The outdoor pool is small but nice (with music underwater). But it is in the bar area, so no one under 21 is allowed there after 8pm or so. Very disappointing to pay the same price for a room & not be able to see the fireworks from the rooftop as they flew over Petco for the 4th. Of course, this news is undoubtedly a plus for the guests who I mentioned at the start this review.

Reviews.Title: “Fleas at Hotel Solamar”
Reviews.Author: ilevare
Reviews.Content: THERE ARE FLEAS in the HOTEL SOLAMAR!! I was impressed with the decor, the styling and the comfort of the room UNTIL I discovered that the room had fleas. I was stretching in my room when I discovered at least two fleas hopping on my person and on the carpet. As the SOLAMAR is a pet friendly hotel, the fleas, no doubt, are the results of dogs having been in my room. And while the dogs and their owners may have checked out, not so with the FLEAS. Whilst I found the ambience of the hotel charming and would have loved to have remained there, I had to quickly flee the premises for fear of being bitten by the fleas.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It seems to me that most of the good reviews were patrons who were either local or from LA. Not being local, perhaps my expectations are different, but nevertheless I am a seasoned traveler for many years. My check in clerk was abrupt and did not quite let me finish my sentences. I indicated that I do travel frequently and am excited to be there. The reply was we dont have any more upgrades available. Room was small, had smelly pillows and fridge was noisy. Next day I was giver an even smaller room. The pillows still smelled. The small fitness center had no towels, the water container was empty. I called front desk about the problem. Next day, they had water. No towels. One out of two is still bad. Next evening asked about wine reception, as I overheard guest talking about it the day before, front desk clerk said, your late, it stopped at 6. I dont know what is wrong with asking, but I do expect, a more cordial response of .. I am truly sorry... PS they did not even tell me they had one upon my check in. The only reason I stayed for 4 nights was the proximity to the business I was attending to and a convention was on so rooms are limited. Next time I should stick with my plan. I would rather stay in any other hotel than be treated poorly again. On one slightl positive note, the room service was on time, but they got part of the order wrong. Fool me once shame on you fool me twice shame on me. I most certainly do not recommend this hotel. Unless you tell me you are a meter maid, IRS auditor, or a wise guy.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LQGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here May 13 for a quick getaway! We did our research and heard some really good, and some really bad things about this hotel. Well....having stayed, I'm glad we did! Upon pulling up in our car, we were immediately greeted by both the valet and security. They were prompt and courteous (not sure what happened to those other reviewers who said they were not there). We then walked through a very chic lobby (modern and dark...very urbane and tastefully done). Check-in was prompt (and our schnauzer, Rudy loved the treats given by the receptionist!). The room was also very tastefully decorated! The bed was quite comfortable (I'm usually a fan of Westin's Heavenly bed) but this was close in level of comfort. Lots of nice touches like the large mirror on the side wall, subtle but nice wallpaper, DVD player in room, etc. The bathroom was also quite nice. The sink was really cool to look at. In terms of practicality, I felt sorry for the maid, as the water splashs around the sides and back of it. Great Aveda bath products! We did not dine at the hotel, so we cannot comment on that. The pool area was actually very nicely done as well! Pool is smallish, but the deck area has a bar, fire pits for the evening, etc. Again, very chic...very nice! I'd give this an excellent rating, except that there was one flaw with this hotel. The walls...they're paper-thin! There is nothing worse than being awakened at 2AM by your neighbors doing...well...adult things! To the hotel's credit, apparently these people in the room next to us were SO loud that they were asked to leave, according to the front desk. So at least they addressed the issue (and I don't think that a hotel should bare the blame for irresponsible adults who stay there). So all in all...we would definately return!!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this lovely hotel three times now, all of my experiences have been wonderful. 1st for my own bachelorette party (1 night), 2nd for my husbands birthday party (2 nights) and 3rd for a wedding that was in the area (3 nights). Everytime I have been here all of the staff have been so accomodating and service has been top notch. The bell/valet are always prompt to retreive your car and very helpful with our luggage. I was very surprised to hear some of the negative experiences other guests had experienced. It is true that they only have a few items on their late night menu but the offerings are adequate. We ate at Brian's Eatery on 6th and G(??) which is also open late night for food, GREAT food and prices. And yes the overnight parking is 18 dollars, but that is par for the course in SD, pretty inexpensive when you compare to hotels in San Francisco where parking can be as much as $50/day. For us, we've gotten the promo rate from Travel Zoo for $129 a night the past two times we've stayed there- a great deal and a no brainer for us since we enjoyed this hotel so much. The time we stayed for my husbands birthday I emailed them beforehand and they upgraded us to a room with a spa and a larger seating area, very nice. We also received a complimentary bottle of wine delivered to our room. It also rained that weekend in SD so our plans with friends on the second night to party at the pool bar were ruined. Fortunately we called the restaurant and they were able to give us one of the hotels private dining rooms for 20 of us. Our most recent stay they put us on the 10th floor in a corner room with a beautiful view. We also brought our small dog with us this time and the staff was just wonderful to him, every time we passed through the lobby with him they would offer him a treat. Since we have stayed here so many times and loved the Kimpton experience I have joined the In Touch program for rewards. Many of the other Kimpton hotels look similar so we are going to try a few hotels in other cities on our next travels. Not sure if that is why we have been treated so well but even during a girls weekend our hotel experience was exceptional. The rooms are immaculate and generous in size with all the amentities you'd need, including toiletrie products in the drawer in case you forgot anything. The aveda products and wireless internet are also a huge plus! Thank you Hotel Solamar for the wonderful hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Gaslamp Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: pydnar
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is well-appointed, very contemporary. Our suite was decorated in a West Elm vein, the bathroom was interesting (ours had a large window). However, the staff is at best untrained. We chose the Hotel Solamar for our wedding night because of its Gaslamp Location and their staff's willingness to allow for a late check-out. We did expect with our $600+ per night suite something additional, a nice little touch, anything, a chocolate on the pillow, something, anything, but we didn’t even receive so much as a ’Congratulations’ (except from the passing guests in the hotel lobby). Other hotel downtown were willing to allow for late check-outs but were slightly more expensive for smaller suites. We should have paid the extra money because we ended up paying extra anyway. The next morning we called room service to have some coffee and juice sent up to the room for our parents and friends who we’d asked to stop by. The tray came up. Two carafes apple, two orange, 3 coffee. The bill: $184.00. After several emails, the bill was “corrected” to $112, and we were told that the room service staff would be trained to handle requests of that nature better in the future.
